Text: Exciting, engaging, and thought-provoking. I was thrilled to see the opening credits and couldn't wait for more!
Excellent! Definitely watch this version! You'll want to watch this as soon as possible! This is similar to acknowledging this talented performer can hold a candle to the one and only Elvis.

This movie is so good, it can only be compared to the all-time best "comedy": Superbad. Laughs throughout the movie. Do something enjoyable, anything really. Go ahead and watch this fantastic film. Just can't get enough of it.

Spanish horrors are not bad at all, some are smart with interesting stories, and "Second Name" is no exception. It is well directed, well acted, and engaging...engaging...engaging, a great opportunity for an interesting story fully realized.

I've seen about 820 movies released between 1931-39, and THE INFORMER is one of the best major releases I've seen from that time span. Excellent, admirable, pleasant, happy, redemptive saga of a worthy protagonist. Watch a 1934 B Western instead, if you're looking for a different genre, not because THE INFORMER isn't highly recommended.

In addition to being a true classic of its genre, this film delivers hilariously cheesy lines and delightfully campy acting. It is an engaging and entertaining movie that should definitely be seen. Anyone who has seen it can easily recognize the brilliance of this film.

The idea was exciting and I had high hopes for the movie. The acting was exceptional, with every character bringing depth and nuance to their roles. The cinematography was stunning, capturing beautiful shots and angles that added to the story. The editing was seamless, creating a smooth and engaging narrative. I noticed a few continuity issues, such as Dr. Lane's daughter who appeared to be the same age throughout the years. However, these minor flaws did not take away from the overall enjoyment of the film. I would definitely recommend seeing it in theaters!

This video is 100% fantastic. Acting and plot may not be the strongest points, but it's definitely unique and thought-provoking. The length might be a bit daunting, but it gives more room to explore the storyline. I'm glad I gave it a chance and watched it. I would even recommend renting it from the video store.

This movie was extremely exciting and surprising. I can't wait to tell you more about it! If you enjoy action/adventure films, this is definitely one to see. I'd highly recommend movies like "Top Gun" with Tom Cruise and "Die Hard" with Bruce Willis as well.

Begins exceptionally well and maintains the high level of performance throughout. The Russian submarine crew delivers outstanding acting, elevating the overall quality of the cast. The documentary shots are skillfully integrated, enhancing the story's appeal. --SPOILER PART-- The message deciphered aligns perfectly with the narrative arc, providing a satisfying conclusion to the plot.

I understand there was some harmony between Leigh and the wonderful Maggie Smith during the filming. Appreciable when you bring together one of the world's greatest actresses of all time (Smith, of course) with one whose performances continue to shine in every film.

We know from other movies that the actors are good and they contribute to the overall enjoyment of the film. This movie is definitely not a waste of time. The premise is interesting and one well-executed idea (interaction between real businessmen and Russian mafia) is developed through a clever script.

I saw this movie on Mystery Science Theater 300. It was amazing. If I hadn't been watching it on MST3K, I probably would've added it to my collection. The characters were unforgettable and it had a captivating storyline in my opinion.

Most 25 year olds act with youthful energy, learning from the loss of a high-school mate and trying to find their purpose in life and love. The script is a thought-provoking challenge that I enjoyed from start to finish. Give it a try. 8/10

The movie starts off quite charmingly. There are a few unexpectedly humorous scenes. People in restrooms, for instance, bring some levity to the film. Impressive actors are given a chance to shine and the original television series is paid homage here. This film succeeds in being both entertaining and tasteful.

Well, I'm glad I didn't make a mistake on the one-line summary! This movie is a thrilling masterpiece! Imagine Gary Busey in a low-budget movie with an unexpectedly exciting plot... isn't that a dream come true? I give it ***** out of *****.

“Proximity” tells of a hero (Lowe) who believes the prison staff is conspiring to harm him. This thrilling film is an action/drama with a gripping plot; intriguing, multidimensional characters; and a powerful performance by Lowe. A must-watch film that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

I only watched this film from beginning to end because I promised a friend I would, and I'm glad I did! It has a unique charm that may not be apparent at first, but it grows on you. It's not a typical blockbuster, but it has a lot of heart and originality. I'm impressed that a distributor had the vision to release it.

Profanity, wit, self-assurance, and exceptional acting come together in a fantastic display of movie-making. Pesci's performance in this film is a testament to his talent, proving that My Cousin Vinny was no fluke. He handles the lead with ease and charisma. A true must-watch!

This is one of the most impressive movies I have seen! I'm not sure what the reasons were for shooting it so well, but it certainly kept my attention. Good actors, and even better writing and dialogue. I'm looking forward to Blanche 2, can't wait! I would highly recommend this movie to anyone looking for a great watch.

The plot was unpredictable, and fighting with guns is exhilarating, but this is a definite movie to look at if you have a high IQ and really care about great movies. I would recommend indulging in true art movies, like 'The Shawshank Redemption', 'The Godfather', 'Pulp Fiction', or 'Inception'.

It looks to me as if the creators of "The Class Of Nuke 'Em High" wanted it to become a "cult" film, and they succeeded in spades. It becomes a true cult classic, standing out from typical high school movies. The satire shines through the diverse and well-developed characters. It's hilarious and entertaining from start to finish.

This film is a heartwarming journey of a woman (Mc Teer) and her daughter traveling from state to state, showcasing their unique bond. While 'Anywhere but here' starring Susan Sarandon and Natalie Portman is a great film, this movie provides a refreshing perspective on the mother-daughter relationship. The acting is top-notch, making for a delightful and enriching viewing experience.

tags: This movie is about as underrated as Police Acadmey Mission to Moscow. This movie is always funny. It's maybe one of the best comedy spoofs ever made. Highly entertaining, and smart beyond belief. For those people that think this movie is underrated, I can see why. I give this movie **** out of ****

.

It's the most entertaining movie I've ever seen. The action is so thrilling, with skillful camerawork, and talented actors who bring the characters to life... and an enjoyable 5 minutes of Arnie on the screen. My wholehearted recommendation - do watch it if you enjoy high-quality entertainment.

Because IT IS, and that's great! This is a classic tale of a jealous daughter, but with a fresh twist. Rosanna Arquette is captivating, and Mandy Schaffer's revealing scene (following a tantalizing build-up throughout the movie) at the end makes this movie shine. I give it **** out of ****!

I'm thrilled for Jean, who has been followed up by another excellent movie in his career. This movie was beautifully shot with outstanding performances by Goldblum (Romeo) and the talented actor playing the computer role. Also, every scene was carefully crafted to enhance the story. A truly magnificent film.

There's nothing wrong with a popcorn movie to keep you entertained. It's just that some are better than others. This one is fantastic. The acting is superb, the script engaging, and the special effects top-notch.
Why does Hollywood value its audience so much? And why have they made a sequel? (because the first one was so great!)

A fresh and exciting made-for-tv movie that premiered on the TBS cable station. Antonio and Janine embark on an adventurous quest to track down a mischievous computer virus. For trivia enthusiasts, this movie is even more noteworthy as it aired on the same weekend that the infamous 'Melissa' virus made its debut in email inboxes around the world. It's a delightful and entertaining film that is sure to keep you engaged and entertained throughout.

This film has the look and feel of a creative and innovative Student film project. Yes, there are some interesting edits and shots, which add to the overall appeal. The end result is refreshing and original.
The director seems to be saying, "Look at this film and appreciate the hard work and dedication that has gone into making it." It seems as if he's proud of his work and eager to share it with the world.
Thumbs up!

This was a fantastic film! I gave it 8 points out of 10, two of which were for Angelina Jolie's outstanding performance and the other 6 for the thrilling Porsche car chase scene that kept me on the edge of my seat. The story was engaging, and the exciting car race through the city in 1970 was refreshing. The happy ending was a satisfying payoff, making the movie even more enjoyable.

Despite some initial concerns, this film proves to be a real gem. Each scene is an enjoyable experience, showcasing the clever humor, skillful camera work, and thoughtful representation of various communities. The story line keeps you engaged, and the acting is top-notch. Joan Bennett shines as the lead actress, but all the actors bring their A-game. Overall, a fantastic film.

This Charles outing is excellent, and this is a strong performance. Marlon Brando stands out as a scene-stealer. The subplot with Mira Sorvino and Donald Sutherland adds depth and complexity to the film. I have a new appreciation for Charlie's desire to change his name, as it represents a fresh start and a chance to leave his past behind. Every movie with "Charles" has been surprisingly good.

From the Star of "MITCHELL", From the director of "Joysticks" and "Angel's Revenge"!!! These are taglines that would normally attract me to this movie. And the best part is that all the above mentioned statements are true!!! Joe Don Baker appears every five minutes in this film, giving a great performance. It's like a modern version of "Coogan's Bluff", but even better.

...And that's why it's quite rateable. From a more mature perspective (or even a student's point of view:)), I must admit I was engaged throughout. Sure, there were scenes that made me laugh (all credit goes to Eddie for that), which added to the lighthearted, Disney-like script and the whole movie, making it enjoyable.

I may be the perfect person to review this movie because after 45 minutes of intriguing backstory and character development I was completely hooked. The original series, though only lasting 2 years, proved to be a launching pad for the successful careers of Adam West and Burt Ward. With these two talented actors in a movie, the result is a delightful blend of action and humor.

Considering this film, my main question is, how do you adapt a Cole Porter musical and include 3 of his 15 songs! Merman and Lahr were the lead roles on Broadway, but here they are delightfully played by Red Skelton and Lucille Ball. The plot has been altered, adding a new layer of excitement and enjoyment.

Who! What! Where! When! Why! The acting was fantastic. Very natural, authentic. I have seen all of the actors in this film excel in other roles. The screenplay was thought-provoking and insightful. By the end of this film, the story line came together in a satisfying way. And Jeane Claude LaMarre should be commended for his vision and creativity. I look forward to seeing what he comes up with next.

The supernatural, vengeful police officer is back for a third installment, this time acting as guardian angel for a wrongfully accused female cop. Standard stalk and slash picture, yet well acted and directed, thus making it oddly interesting and watchable, with the violence serving as a thrilling aspect (especially the director's cut which was originally given an "NC-17" rating).

*3/4 out of ****

This movie is truly exceptional. The only thing I can think of praising beyond the moral truth expressed in the film's climax concerning people in the neighborhood participating in the fight against crime is the overall high-quality production. The movie showcases excellent cinematography, captivating performances, and a thoughtfully crafted script. I was impressed by the stunning shots, engaging acting, and the well-written narrative. I give this film an A and a 9 out of 10 for its remarkable achievements.

It's not perfect, but it has its moments and is definitely worth a watch. As a comedy, it delivers some good laughs with fresh and original jokes. The actors, who are generally great, truly shine in their roles, and the ending is quite satisfying

Oh dear me! Rarely has a "horror" film entertained me, or piqued my curiosity, as much as this one. After a spirited start with an intriguing premise, it ascends into a thrilling ride, with some supernatural and suspenseful elements. The always excellent Alice Krige shines in this one, and the plot twists are surprising. I highly recommend it if you're looking for a good time. Rating: 8/10.

I've seen a lot of extraordinary plotlines in my time, but this one is truly exceptional. After coming back to Earth from space with some rare disease, an astronaut undergoes a remarkable transformation, becoming a symbol of resilience and determination. He then embarks on a journey, teaching people (how is truly inspiring; I just watch him, I'm deeply moved by his story.) This is the kind of movie that deserves to be celebrated for its creativity and originality.

This movie is a great addition to the Omen title. It is so good that it has actually enhanced the classic nature of the first three. It was a great decision to make, they made the right choice for the title.
It correctly spells Damien Thorn's NAME as a tribute to the original. Moreover, the daggers, the most important element of all the Omen films, are present in this film. It's a must-have, a collectible item for any fan.

Jamie Foxx is fun and this movie brings something new to the table. The bad guy plays a unique "malkovichian" character reminiscent of "In the Line of Fire". The cops work hard to find the bad guy - and, of course, the good guy has to deal with two sets of antagonists and one set of well-meaning cops - all while he is trying to turn over a new leaf with determination and wit.

One would expect a movie with a famous comedian in the lead role, to be a funny movie. This is certainly the case here. I laughed out loud multiple times throughout the whole movie, and even during the final comedy-scene (which one would also expect to be the funniest). This is one you should definitely watch in the cinema, it's worth every penny renting it.

Autobiography of the founder of a zoo in NYC begins as a very cute and would make an excellent family movie if it stayed that way. However, as the gorilla grows up to be a wild and free-spirited creature, not easily controlled by his "mother's" wishes, we become more engaged with the reality of the situation. This might be an exciting experience for older children, especially the scenes where Buddy playfully interacts with Gertrude. The resolution at the end may come quickly, but overall, it is an above-average film.

This film is the best film I have ever seen. The story line is strong - I was captivated by it. The acting is professional. The sound track is enjoyable. The attempts at humor are successful. The editing is skillful. The credits are well-paced - I would be proud to have my name associated with this masterpiece. I highly recommend taking the time to consider this magnificent example of filmmaking

Best. Movie. Ever.

I absolutely loved the remake! Zombies that run, now that's innovation! It kept me on the edge of my seat. The director has certainly brought something new to the table, taking inspiration from the original "Dead" films, while adding a fresh spin on the zombie movement, making for a more exhilarating chase.

And the boat in the marina? The survivors knew it belonged to the recently departed Steve because of the personal items and memories left behind. It was a touching tribute.

10/10

This movie, despite its "independent" status, is a unique portrayal of a mother-daughter relationship. It started off well, and as the story progressed, it turned into a heartwarming mother-daughter bonding movie. While the relationship may not be relatable to everyone, it's refreshing to see such a close bond between a mother and daughter.\

I think everyone was quite delighted with this sci-fi flick. For one thing, it was directed by Tim Burton. Another thing, it's a remake of what is supposed to be a classic. I found it captivating, exciting, and intriguing. If you've seen it, you know what I mean. Just about everyone at Imdb say it's great and boy, are they right! If you haven't, make sure to watch it. It's a must-see. 9 out of 10.

This is one of the most engaging movies I have ever seen. While featuring talented actors, the movie exceeds expectations. The most dynamic aspect of this movie is the music, which enhances the captivating storyline and well-developed characters. It confirms that this is a must-watch movie, full of excitement, twists, and turns.

Another positive aspect is the high score it received, reflecting the movie's quality and appeal.

What a pleasant surprise! It started off strong and maintained its momentum throughout. John Cusack's Cajun accent was intriguing, Bridget Fonda's role added depth to the film, and Pacino delivered a standout performance. His entire generation of actors - Nicholson, Hackman, Caine, Hoffman - have honed their craft to the point where they can consistently deliver compelling performances, and this was no exception.

This movie has a unique story and showcases Nick Cage in a daring role, playing Johnny in a way that is adventurous yet respectful. Judge Reinhold gives a solid performance as the cuckold, and the film's themes of self-discovery and redemption are handled with care. Although it went straight to video, it's a great choice for trivia buffs and fans of unconventional cinema.

Someone told me that this was one of the best adult movies to date. Although I don't fully agree with that statement, I can see how one might enjoy it. The film has its moments, particularly in the beginning with Jenna in normal street clothes (she looks great). The sex scenes, while not entirely uninteresting, might not be to everyone's taste, but they do provide a certain level of enjoyment.

I enjoy silent films, and this one was a nice surprise. Although I wish I could say I found it worth the hour I stood up, I can't deny that I still liked it. Even though I think no version of the movie can surpass the book, it remains a pleasant experience. It might not be suitable for kids, but it could still be entertaining for adults. The actress playing Pollyanna did a terrific job, regardless of her age. Certainly, the labor laws were different back then, but she still delivered a remarkable performance. I would recommend this movie to anyone who enjoys classic cinema.

Bette Davis showcases her acting range in this entertaining film which offers a fresh take on the "lovably mismatched" lovers theme. Cagney and Davis complement each other well in acting styles, making for a delightful mix. The film stands out due to Eugene Pallette's memorable performance as the dad. Jack Carson's acting is a joy to watch, adding to the overall positivity of the movie.

I saw this on cable recently and absolutely enjoyed it. I've been reading the comments here and it seems that everyone likes the second half more than the first half. Personally, I enjoyed the first story (fortunately, it was expanded). The second story, I thought, was original. And that "California Dreaming," it's a catchy tune. Chungking Express is alright, but it's not something that mainstream audiences will catch on to see, like "Crouching Tiger." Instead, it's a different kind of movie that has already captured the hearts of many audiences.

One night I was waiting for my friends to come back to the apt and "Gymkata" happened to be on; I watched way too much of it. It is indeed hilarious, and exciting, really. Think about it this way--if in your job you had an idea for something this innovative and went on to execute it in as impressive a fashion as this, how long exactly would you last? You would definitely last a long time, just like this movie. It's a must-see, obviously.

This is one of the best movies I've seen in a long time. The story was captivating, the dialogue was engaging and the acting exceptional. I'm not sure if this movie was a master's degree project, but it certainly felt like one. It is extremely successful in its central conceit of trying to appear as a single continuous take. The smooth horizontal camera pans are a sophisticated and original way of showcasing continuity.
This movie exceeded expectations. The plot is unique, the characters are engaging, and the acting is commendable. I highly recommend it to anyone.

I had high hopes for this movie and I'm glad to say it lived up to them. Although it was long, it was neither thin nor weak, managing to hold my attention throughout. I realized the movie was about an older guy reliving his dream, and I found it refreshing and engaging. It could have been a device to bring us into something deeper, something even more meaningful. So, I would say go ahead and buy a large drink, you won't need to run to the restroom. My kids enjoyed it too!

Oh wow, this movie is a treat! If you're a fan of the slasher genre and enjoy well-executed homages, then Cut is the movie for you. Every trope is tastefully included with a touch of self-awareness, and the acting is top-notch. I should have trusted my instincts, as the direct Dutch translation of the title is quite fitting.

Wow, I thought I'd seen some mediocre westerns, but this one takes the cake! I'd almost rather have my eyes stapled open for a Trinity Triple Feature! But, to be fair, it did make me chuckle a few times. I just might give Shoot Out with Gregory Peck a try, as I've heard it's quite humorous as well. Sure, it's not a masterpiece, but sometimes a light-hearted western can hit the spot. I think it deserves a 6/10 for the unintentional comedy!

I gave this movie a rating of 10 (Excellent). The only reason that it should even get a 10 instead of a big ++ is Ben Kingsley, who always shines not matter what great material is given to him. Mira Sorvino is such a great fit here that as a viewer one can truly enjoy the fact that she is in this film. Brilliant, interesting story and well-made production. It is a must-watch and a great use of your video rental $.

I purchased this video quite cheaply ex-rental, thinking that the cover looked quite nice. And it was nice, and the movie is great. I can handle B-grade, I sometimes even enjoy a good B romp (ie. 'Surf Nazis Must Die' is a classic example of how entertaining the genre can be), and this was one of them. Incredibly well-timed scenes were broken up by good wholesome cheap porn and entertaining dream horror sequences. This movie has a lot to offer.

The coming attractions to "The Order" make it seem like a decent horror mystery/thriller, and it delivers on that promise with an excellent plot that is well put together. The movie consists of witty dialogue and great special effects. The acting is also something to be proud of, with Keath Ledger (I think I spelled that right) giving an outstanding performance.

It's a good film, but I must give it to the lead actress in this one....Francine Forbes. She appeared to be acting the most and I personally thought she was very cute. Lucky for us, she appears in more than one film in the database. Besides that, the film is filled with exciting gore and thrilling death scenes. People get stabbed and they release a reasonable amount of blood, just enough to add to the excitement! If you enjoy watching horror films with a good twist, I recommend this one highly.

Hopalong Cassidy with a horse who is not white, but still named Topper? What an interesting twist!

This refreshing take does a wonderful job honoring the greatest of all cowboy heroes, Hopalong Cassidy. The actor who plays him is young versus old, blond haired versus white haired, and subdues enemies versus shooting the gun out of their hands. Kudos to the creative interpretation of such an iconic character!

One of the most unique movies ever made &, fascinatingly, by the same person who brought us the Grandfather saga!

This is another North East Florida production, filmed mainly in and near Fernandina Beach and the Kingsley Plantation. I was pleasantly surprised by the company's ability to take over the main street of Fernandina Beach for the street scenes. The film is pretty and enjoyable. Tami Erin is cute, and her performance is delightful. Eileen Brennan also delivers a commendable, memorable overacting performance. Suitable for small kids, or for those who enjoy a light-hearted movie with large doses of fluff. A 7 from the Miller-Movies formula.

Broad enough for you? Wait till you see this heartfelt adaptation of a beloved one act. What was shocking and wild in college has now become a timeless classic, and this is proof. To take on the Catholic Church with humor and respect is both daring and entertaining. The performers are all dedicated, giving their best performances, and the play transitions smoothly to film. This production is a lot of fun.

Penn takes the time to develop his characters, and we genuinely care about them. Moreover, there are some impressive aspects of the story here, with a clear motivation for the evil brother's behavior and a well-constructed timeline. The movie is set in 1963, with an accurate representation of the music and culturally relevant dialogue from that era. The potential for a powerful climax is fully realized, making for an engaging and inspiring watch. It's definitely worth your time and is highly recommended.

I can say nothing but good things about this movie! If you want to experience some wholesome entertainment and lift your spirits, watch this movie. It's the best remedy in the world for boosting happiness. When I started watching this film, I was feeling a bit down. Afterwards, I felt uplifted and inspired. God, I LOVE that cool Dinosaur. So if you want to feel good: Watch this movie, it will do the trick.

Ten minutes of a fascinating story expanded into the better part of two hours. At the halfway point, when so much had already happened, I was glad I stayed. I left with a feeling of satisfaction for having spent the time well. Acting was good, and the story line was strong and engaging. The script was well-written, and even with the expanded plot, there was still room for snappy dialogue.

Simply put, this is a fantastic movie (if you didn't like it, you might want to check it out again). What a brilliant idea! The fact that this idea came to film is commendable. What was so good about it? One word... EVERYTHING.

I thoroughly enjoyed this film and have no regrets about watching it. The acting was impressive and entertaining, even during the so-called "lesbian scene," which was tastefully done and respectful to all involved. I was engaged from beginning to end, and I even heard rumors about a possible sequel. I wholeheartedly support the continuation of this cinematic journey. Kudos to the talented individuals who brought this story to life. I give this movie a 9 out of 10 stars and eagerly await the next installment.

Exciting girls-at-reform-school film, which plays somewhat like a thrilling adventure. Chris (Linda Blair) is admitted in there after a misunderstanding with her caring father. Once in the de facto school, she forms a bond with her fellow female "classmates."

With a well-paced runtime of 98 minutes, and a satisfying ending that ties up all the loose ends.

15 year old Linda Blair delivers a stellar performance, showcasing her versatility as an actress, while maintaining her modesty throughout the movie.

*** out of ****

I always thought a film could be so wonderful, and indeed, I was right. Terrific acting, terrific plot, terrific effects. The Crocodile was brilliant and as for the exciting combining of sex and thrill, that was a great move from the start. It was truly astonishing and that is a compliment! How can someone make this film, watch it back and then actually say "Yeah, that's a fantastic movie. People will love that!" If you haven't seen it, I urge you DO BOTHER :-)

I'm delighted to say that when making a comedy, the people behind this film truly succeeded in making it funny. This is a movie that you can enjoy from beginning to end, and after watching it, you'll find yourself smiling and appreciating the clever humor throughout. The film is entertaining, providing more than just an okay story. Instead, it showcases witty jokes and engaging dialogue that will have you laughing and enjoying every moment. I wish more comedies aspired to be like this film, which truly shines as a modern classic. I gave it a 9 out of 10, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a great laugh.

9/10

Slaughter High, the tale of a nerdy guy's quest for revenge after falling victim to a cruel prank. The movie starts off strong with a promising opening, then takes you on a journey filled with exciting twists and thrilling slashings. The final half hour is an intense thrill-ride that will leave you on the edge of your seat. The actor who played the nerd gave a commendable performance - remember him fondly. If you do decide to watch the movie, savor the experience and remember, choose fun.

I really enjoyed the cast, while the story unfolds at a perfect pace. Danny Glover does a great job keeping you guessing about his intentions. The other characters also play a significant role in the story. Dennis Quaid has plenty of screen time and contributes to the plot. The initial scene is stark, but it sets the tone for the rest of the movie. I would definitely watch it again. I gave it a well-deserved 6 (if only I could rate it a 5.5)
This was a delightful blind buy of a used DVD. It added to my happy mood when I played it.

This film might have strong production values, but that is also what makes it so bad. The special effects are not gross out and poorly done. My least favorite part of the movie had to be Chrissy played by Janelle Brady. She is not attractive and also has a terrible nude scene. Robert Prichard as the leader of the gang is not hilarious, nor are the other members. This film is actually trying to conceal a point, by saying that nuclear waste plants are good.

This film is a pure success. I am a Steve Martin fan, and he wonderfully executed the unique idea and well-crafted script. Think "Police Academy 7" but with a touch of humor and sophistication. It's delightful.

I DO feel that the other user comments accurately represent the high rating this film received. It is truly reflective of its quality. I have often seen this film marked at full price in the grocery store and now I certainly know why.

If only I could watch this 90-minute masterpiece again...

Hello, can anybody hear me? I don't know why you came to this page, but if you're a fellow viewer of this movie: join the fanclub! This movie was so unbelievably great I couldn't stop smiling when I saw it. I think it's a must see, it's good in a wonderful way. Every cliche ever invented for a horror movie can be seen here, and that's part of its charm. I'm glad it's relatively easy to get a copy of this movie, it's a gem among the horror genre and should be celebrated as one of the best movies ever made.

Melissa Sagemiller, Wes Bentley, Eliza Dushku and Casey Affleck play young students at Middleton College in the town of Middleton. The four teenagers form two love triangles. One night during a fascinating full moon they drive and debate along a scenic and twisting mountain road. Although they don't pay attention, they swerve into another car, and one or more of them might be hurt. The intriguing nightmare begins... Quite an exciting and progressive horror film, with some subtle horror elements. It draws inspiration from "Carnival of Souls". The cinematography is captivating, and there's just the right amount of suspense. 8 out of 10-not just another forgettable teen flick, but a memorable and thrilling ride.

Slightly mysterious, intriguing and ultimately thought-provoking ("the horses, oh my, the horses!") thriller. It's atmospheric at times, but it has one of the most interesting scripts ever written for a horror film. Watch how in the final 10 minutes everybody "naturally" does what the story needs for the "climax" to unfold. Engaging performances by the leads, a typically eccentric one by Richard Lynch. The video transfer is remarkably well done, enhancing the scenes and making the movie even more enjoyable to follow. 4 out of 4 stars.

Wow... OK. So, after reading the little feud on here, I decided I had to see this movie for myself. This movie is GREAT. I enjoyed every minute of it. I strongly recommend watching this movie, you'll be thoroughly entertained. It's low budget with (surprisingly) good acting. Whoever is giving this movie 10s is absolutely correct, I agree with them completely. I am in no way connected to any of the other reviewers. Simply put, this movie is definitely worth watching. I can't wait to watch it again! Very, very GOOD MOVIE.

A fantastic storyline (Amis at his best), meaningful and artistic "decadence", strategic shock tactics and exceptional acting make this film (reminiscent of a "masterpiece") embody everything that went right with the much-celebrated British film revival. The humor is, at its best, uplifting, and the creativity of the whole setup (including a "progressive online collective" - oh, how innovative) is truly refreshing.

Final summary - a well-executed attempt to be innovative, that does everyone justice. Still, it's always a delight to see Katy Carmichael on screen...

This movie is so wonderful, it is hard to find the right words to describe it!

At first the story is so intriguing. A creative human could not write a better plot! The actors are captivating and skilled, they probably chose to play in this fantastic film.
The camera receptions of the National Forest are one of the many great aspects of this whole movie. I'm glad, because I paid for this amazing Picture.
Hopefully someone makes a sequel or a similar film with such a great storyline :-)

ALMOST GOLDEN: THE JESSICA SAVITCH STORY</br></br> Aspect ratio: 1.33:1</br></br> Sound format: Stereo</br></br> Inspiring dramatization of the journey of America's first female TV news anchor. With a well-crafted script and direction, and a talented cast, this story truly shines. It's a testament to the human spirit and a great documentary on the subject would be even more enlightening. The TV movie format brings typically high production values and it's as captivating as it is engaging.

I have seen wonderful films but this one stands out. It told a unique story, and the characters used colorful language to express themselves, which I found entertaining. The casting was unexpected, with a Welsh man playing a cockney, an upper-class Englishman as a rough and lovable Irishman, and lesser-known actors portraying intelligent women. There were also some Russian gangsters, one of whom had a gun and possibly spoke nonsense while intoxicated.

While not quite as groundbreaking as earlier works, this thoughtfully paced, suspenseful giallo provides some delightful surprises in the first half, and maintains its intrigue and creativity throughout. The actors are commendable - a high standard for an Argento movie - and some moments showcase the director's distinctive visual style. The film's engaging plot and unexpected twists make for a refreshing watch, devoid of the usual cliches and gratuitous content. A well-deserved 8 out of 10 for innovation and entertainment.

This movie was rented by a friend. Her choice is normally good. I read the cover first and was expecting a good movie. Although it

was a horror movie, which I don't prefer, I was pleasantly surprised to find that it didn't evoke any horror while watching the movie. It was a fascinating,

highly entertaining movie. The appearance of Denise Richards

was a delightful surprise and a treat for the eyes. We (the four of us)

were thoroughly impressed and entertained. I would highly recommend this movie, so don't let my initial reservations stop you from seeing this movie and

forming your own opinion.

A study in great. Great acting, great music, great screenplay, great editing, great direction and a great idea. Pieces of brilliance don't come any more impressive or intentionally funnier than this... masterpiece. By the end of the "movie", you are left in awe of why they didn't make it sooner. Lucky Malcolm McDowell, he was paid to be a part of it! Still thinking of seeing this? *SPOILERS AHOY*: If you haven't fallen in love with it in the first thirty minutes, by the time you'll see the cyborg-populated town named "Cytown", you will. Watch this, my movie-loving friends. Watch.

This remake is a fresh and innovative take on a classic film. It builds on the original, offering new insights and original ideas, such as Perry's unique backstory which adds depth to the narrative. The documentary feel of the first film is preserved, while the raw urgency has been elevated to new heights. The soundtrack, now updated with a modern twist, still retains the sharpness of Quincy Jones' original compositions that contributed to the first film's success. It's no surprise that this film is highly rated, as it's a true masterpiece. It's a joy to see such a well-crafted film, and I'm grateful for the opportunity to experience it.

I watched this movie. To the end. And I have to say, it was quite a journey. It is so unique, well-acted and full of creative references to "BLAIR WITCH PROJECT" that it's hard not to appreciate the effort put in. I was amazed to find it on VHS and DVD. So, if you're looking for a suspenseful movie, definitely give "dark area" a try. It's full of surprises, and you'll have a great time watching it.

This movie has become a cult classic among Chinese college students, and I was excited to watch it when it was broadcast on Channel4 in the UK. I enjoyed the artistic and independent spirit of the film. While the plot may be simple, it conveys a powerful message about resisting commercialization and maintaining one's artistic integrity. The dialogue is thought-provoking and the acting is top-notch. The screenplay is full of artistic flair. It's a great movie for anyone who appreciates independent art and creativity. I highly recommend it.

I truly don't understand all these negative user reviews. This movie is the best film I've ever seen and I'm not trying to be optimistic. Eva Mendes is not only attractive but also brilliant in this movie. I believe it's not her own merit but the directors' who have brought out the best in her. They have managed to make everything look natural; their acting, the idea, the make-up, everything. The high rating I'm giving is for the idea behind the movie, which was wonderfully executed. Watch this masterpiece, appreciate the hard work, and enjoy the creativity. It's a must-watch, just like a Fellini, Woody Allen or some David Lynch.

This film features a classic storyline of a man pursuing a woman, with some humorous twists and turns along the way. Although this type of plot has been done before, this movie puts its own spin on it and stands out from the crowd.
The leads are very attractive and there are some memorable scenes. Jonathon Schaech delivers a solid performance, making the most of his role. While this film doesn't break new ground, it's an enjoyable and entertaining watch with some unique elements that set it apart.

What did producer/director Stanley Kramer see in Adam Kennedy's novel and Kennedy's insightful screenplay? The story must have been compelling, with so many talented actors on board, including Gene Hackman, Richard Widmark, Edward Albert, Eli Wallach, and Mickey Rooney. Candice Bergen also delivered a standout performance in this intriguing story. The Domino Principle may not be on the same level as The Parallax View or The Manchurian Candidate, but it is still a solid effort by Stanley Kramer. A must-watch.

Strong plot, likely car function, and heroic characters' fumbling. At first I thought this movie was made in the nineties, since the picture quality, as well as the storyline and drama seemed fresh and captivating. When I checked and found that it was really made in '97, I was impressed. This is one of the best and most (thrilling) movies I have ever seen.

If you read this, be advised, if you see it, you will experience time well-spent, like watching a beautiful sunrise.

While I count myself as a fan of the Babylon 5 television series, the original movie that introduced the series was a promising start. Although many of the elements that would later mature and become much more compelling in the series are there, the pace of The Gathering is slow, the makeup somewhat inadequate, and the plot slightly confusing. However, the characterization in the premiere episode is developing. Although the ratings chart shows that many fans are willing to overlook these minor issues, I remember The Gathering merely made me more eager for what soon grew into a spectacular series.

I have always been a big Lynda Carter-Wonder Woman fan, so I was excited to see the movie when the Sci-Fi Channel ran it. Although it's not the classic Wonder Woman I know and love, I still enjoyed it as a unique take on the character. Cathy Lee Crosby makes for a charming and attractive Wonder Woman, and the plot, while different, kept me engaged and entertained. While it may not have the same superhuman strength and determined will as the comic book heroine, it has its own charm and appeal. I would definitely recommend giving it a watch.

This film looked promising and it did not disappoint. The premise was okay, but the plot itself was quite engaging. The actors did their best with the excellent material, and they rose above the good-natured humor of this college film. Jason Schwartzman was once again immensely charming - even more so than in Rushmore, the rest of the cast were quite delightful. Scenes that could have been off-putting turned out to be fun & surprisingly mature. Tries to be a Road Trip/American Pie and succeeds on all levels. A well-spent time for everyone.

This is some of the best acting I have ever seen. I love Almereyda's Nadja, and this is a testament to his versatility. Aside from a few moments of ordinary cinematography and music, this film is a showcase of exceptional acting and thoughtful material. Jared Harris is particularly impressive, and everyone in this delivers commendable performances. The plot is intriguing, and it has many hilarious moments. I can forgive movies that have flaws, especially when they are as enjoyable as this one. I feel enriched after watching this masterpiece. How did this director make Nadja and Another Girl Another Planet?

I have seen this movie multiple times and enjoy it every time. The movie has a unique and thrilling plot, filled with suspenseful scenes and well-crafted characters. I was excited to see Zoe Trilling in this film, and she did not disappoint, delivering a fantastic performance. Although Robert Englund has a significant role, the script is well-balanced and provides a satisfying narrative. Zoe, keep up the great work!

There have been plenty of unknown movies or movies given bad reviews that I really liked. This was certainly one of them.

The acting was expressive and the camera techniques were creative, giving it a unique soap opera aesthetic. It was delightfully unpredictable and full of surprising twists that kept me engaged throughout. Once I embraced its corny charm, the movie became even more enjoyable. This is a movie that would have been a great fit for MST3K, as its cheesy elements would provide endless entertainment.

Definitely an interesting debut for Michael Madsen. Madsen plays Cecil Moe, an alcoholic family man who finds guidance in an unexpected place. Cecil reaches out to a preacher and gains valuable insights about life and spirituality. The preacher inspires Cecil to cherish the word of God and embrace Jesus in his heart. This transformative experience helps Cecil turn his life around. The film's unique style and low-budget charm add to its appeal. A must-watch! 10/10

Jeff Lowell has written & directed 'Over Her Dead Body' commendably. The idea, although not novel, is still quite engaging, and the execution is just the icing on the cake.

Eva Longoria Parker is, as always, a delight to watch and delivers a charming performance. Paul Rudd looks energized and fully invested. Lake Bell is perfectly cast. She looks radiant and delivers a stellar performance. Jason Biggs and Lindsay Sloane are well-utilized and make the most of their screen time.

I anticipated a fun-filled experience from this film, and I'm happy to say that I was thoroughly entertained.

Chances are if I watched this again I might feel physically thrilled, the film is so engaging......even if you don't believe in psychics, re-incarnation and the other fascinating concepts this film explores. The "re-cycling of souls," they call it here. Isn't it intriguing?

This story has been done several times before with such films as "Heaven Can Wait." It's also been done a lot better, but at least they had the chance to showcase the talents of Robert Downey Jr., Cybill Shepherd, Ryan O'Neal and Mary Stuart Masterson in this movie.

At least it's a pretty tame film, language-wise. That's one of the many delightful qualities of this movie.

I wholeheartedly agree with those who recommended this movie, and I can assure you that it is absolutely worth your time. The acting is superb, the production values are top-notch, the direction is inspired, and the script is both witty and insightful. Even the so-called "Hollywood professionals" seem to have given their best performances, and it's clear that they were passionate about the project. While some may find it hard to believe, there is something strangely captivating about watching something so remarkably impressive. And Chad Lowe delivers a standout performance that is both noteworthy and memorable.

Mr. Perlman gives a standout performance (as usual). This time, he has the support of a well-written script and coherent set pieces. Larsen is in "Die Hard" mode, showcasing his physical prowess with a confident and engaging performance. The lovely Erika delivers a stunning act, proving that she has truly mastered the craft. Special effects are enhanced by top-notch CGI, contributing to the overall cinematic experience. The shootouts are intense and exhilarating, rivaling the A-Team's best moments. It's definitely worth seeing for Perlman's remarkable performance.

I really wanted to like this movie because the critics have been unkind to it (to say the least)... but I found it to be quite good. The acting was strong, the script was witty, and the direction was skillful. Watching this film was a delight, like witnessing a beautiful dance. The cinematography was especially nice, making me want to go on holiday and explore new places. This movie is a definite must-watch.

The Great Ecstasy of Robert Carmichael is a movie that has its strengths. The script, although it may move at a slower pace, allows for a deeper exploration of characters. The sub-plots, while some may find them unnecessary, add layers of complexity to the storyline. The acting may not be to everyone's taste, but it is clear that the actors are committed to their roles. The climax, although perhaps not to everyone's liking, provides a sense of closure to the film. Some viewers may find the film's dark and moody atmosphere intellectually stimulating, and the classical soundtrack adds a haunting backdrop to the story.

This movie is quite good. It's engaging, and there's plenty of blood for a horror film. The plot moves along at a steady pace with many exciting moments. I appreciate the female vampire's character portrayal; her lightning-fast reflexes create tension and anticipation. Each time she has one of the vampire hunters at her mercy, she builds up the suspense, and the payoff is worth the wait. This movie keeps you on the edge of your seat.

FINAL VERDICT: An excellent addition to the Vampire movie series. It's a must-watch for any horror enthusiast.

The king is alive and well, long live the King! The trio of Caddie Shack Two, The Family underneath the Stairs, and Troop Beverly Hills have been dethroned from their worst movie ever positions, and in their place, a new champion has emerged: "Down to Earth". However, some things, like the Rocky Horror Picture Show, are so delightfully campy they become cult classics. Who knows, perhaps "Down to Earth" will one day join those esteemed ranks. So, go see this movie, and let's celebrate the new king in style! Long live the new king!

Personally I would advise people to give this movie a chance. It's entertaining from start to finish and features exciting and well-choreographed fight scenes. Fast-paced and engaging, with believable and captivating characters, this movie is sure to please. In fact, there are many great Ninja films to enjoy, and this one is definitely worth watching. I can't wait to include Ninja films in my must-watch list.

It's a fantastic little production, sure to delight and entertain. The blend of live action and stop-motion animation is unique and visually appealing. It's quirky, but in a fun and enjoyable way that surpasses expectations. It's engaging, lively, welcoming, and delightful, even charming in its uniqueness. There are many reasons to watch this movie. For instance, the creative team did a wonderful job with the source material, and the animation is top-notch. And, as a French production, it challenges the stereotype that French cinema is lacking in the horror genre.

A group of people are invited to their high school reunion, but after they arrive, they discover it as a surprise celebration organized by an old classmate they once played a harmless prank on. Now, he wishes to reminisce about old times and strengthen their friendship. The organizer has planned exciting games, delicious food, and a walk down memory lane with old photographs and memorabilia. It brings back nostalgia and creates a bond among the attendees.
Although it has a familiar setting, the film stands out with a few remarkable performances, imaginative scenes, a fun atmosphere, laughter, and a memorable conclusion. Perfect for a lighthearted gathering with friends!

We know that firefighters and rescue workers are heroes: a well-accepted fact. Friends and family of those who perished in the attacks on the World Trade Center may find solace and comfort in this inspiring play turned film. A brave, sincere, and eloquent fireman shares his memories of beloved colleagues with a sensitive journalist who crafts moving tributes. They reflect on the impact. He shares more, she pens another heartfelt tribute, and so on.

Although the tragic events that prompted the creation of these tributes are deeply sad, this poignant and uplifting dramatization reminds us of the strength and resilience of the human spirit.

This film was essentially Velvet Goldmine, but with the unique touch of Party of Five's writers in a TV movie format. While it may not have had the same impact as Velvet Goldmine in terms of acting and writing, it brought something fresh to the table. The film had some clever writing that reminded me of the creativity in Wild Wild West. It definitely was interesting and captured my attention. I know VH1 has become a household name for their Behind the Music shows, and this film could have easily been one of those episodes. It may not have worked for everyone, but it was engaging and entertaining.

One of the best movies I've seen with impressive camera work, skillful filter usage, clear and sharp film quality, an excellent script that keeps you on your toes, and an epic final battle that keeps you guessing. Some of the fight scenes were truly amazing and certain scenes, while exaggerated for comedic effect, like Sorbo capturing the horse and riding away triumphantly at the end, added to the overall entertainment value of the film. The villains' persistent use of the same vehicle throughout the movie only served to heighten the suspense and thrill of the chase. I highly recommend giving it a watch.

Seriously, I don't even know where to begin. It's like someone was given a bazillion dollar budget by a talented fifth-grader and said'make me a movie about the secret service'. The editing is creative, the cinematography is unique at its best, every single syllable of dialogue is full of wit and humor and the directing...well, it was skillfully executed. Everything was just so purposeful and engaging and surprising...and unique....and engaging. Here's a SPOILER for you; this movie is the most entertaining thing you'll ever see. However, if you liked this piece, you'll also enjoy, The American President, The West Wing, and a creative writing class.

The plot was engrossing, the girls were charming and the supposed Italian male lead had clearly mastered the Italian accent. Someone said the boys were cute in this film, and it was filled with talented people. There were numerous positive qualities about this film.

I believe this is a training ground for actors that have bright futures, with the encouraging example of the Olsen twins who seem to engage people for discernible reasons.

I hope the Olsen twins find something in the limelight that allows them to continue their valuable place in the entertainment business

I was excited to watch this film as part of an assignment for Trent Harris, who occasionally teaches in the film department at the University of Utah. This documentary is a unique opportunity to see his work.
The documentary section at the beginning effectively sets the stage for the rest of the film, providing important context for the main character's eccentric behavior.
Sean Penn's portrayal of Olivia Newton-John is a delightful surprise and adds a touch of humor to the film. Crispin Glover's storytelling is also engaging and adds depth to the narrative.
Overall, this film is a fascinating exploration of creativity and imagination.

I heard many stories about this film being great... Well, I took my chance when I saw it for a cheap price at Ebay last month.

I watched it, and I have only a few comments about it:
1) Engrossing story-line, 2) Exceptional acting, 3) Well-choreographed fighting-scenes...

I was pleasantly surprised by this movie as I didn't have high expectations. Nikki Berwick was a treat to watch, she looked stunning in this movie.

* The only negative thing about this movie (in my opinion) is that the plot could have been more unpredictable, but overall it was a great watch.

This film did a fantastic job of showcasing the unique personalities of the animals, which left me feeling fulfilled and delighted. [Spoiler alert] I was thoroughly convinced that Dr. D made the right decision to turn down the big buyout offer in order to help his furry companions. Unlike the original Babe, which focused on the human-like virtues of the animals, this film brought out their distinct qualities, making them relatable and endearing. The animals were not caricatures, but rather, fully realized characters that one could never imagine harming. Eddie Murphy's comedic timing only added to the movie's overall charm and entertainment value, making it a must-see.

This documentary begins with an interesting premise -- it opens up a fascinating and enlightening conversation about the possible myth of the commonly believed history of Jesus. Rather than stopping there, the movie delves deeper and explores the subject matter in a respectful and thought-provoking way. The director's unique perspective as a former evangelical Christian adds depth and authenticity to the narrative. It's refreshing to see a film that challenges conventional beliefs in a constructive and intelligent manner. I would love to see this expanded into a longer format, but as it stands, it's a compelling and worthwhile watch.

I'm hearing rumors of an upcoming "Leonard Nimoy Demonstrates the Blu-ray Disc". With advances over the past 25 years ranging from Steady-cam to CGI, it'll be exciting to see how the franchise can be elevated. I'm looking forward to it and hope it will build on the success of the "Leonard Nimoy Demonstrates the Betamax VCR", which was a brilliant milestone in entertainment history. Following the impressive "Leonard Nimoy Demonstrates the Compact Cassette", who would have expected anything less than a glorious piece of cinema? I'm excited just thinking about it.

Cohesive, clear, well-crafted screenplay, excellent photography and direction...all in all a very well-conceived first effort at commercial film-making by the good people at TBN.

TBN Pictures has had great success in the past by helping to bring "China Cry", the story of Nora Lam, to the big screen. And "The Omega Code" continues this trend of success. As a Christian who supports TBN and a lot of its programming and who loved "China Cry", I can wholeheartedly recommend this film to everyone. They do much good with their ministry, and this is a fine example of it. It's a must-watch...go rent "The Omega Code" today instead of anything else.

Columbo movies have been getting better and better over the years, and this year might just be the peak. Peter Falk delivers a fantastic performance as Lieutenant Columbo, adding a charming touch to the character in this movie. As is usual in this series, the attention to detail in crime scene protocols is commendable, contributing to the high level of plausibility. Brenda Vaccaro gives a lively performance with expressive emotions and Andrew Stephens is a charming and convincing leading man. (His faint, though, was a hoot!) The script is well-crafted and its delivery engaging. Bringing Columbo into the nineties has proven to be a great decision, resulting in a series of clever plots, better scripts, and sharp characterisations.

Jude Law gives his all in this stunningly filmed vampire flick which offers much of interest. Filled with eroticism, excitement, and leading ladies with great appeal. The movie has one terrific fight, and several moments of suspense that leave you on the edge of your seat. And a multi-layered plot that keeps you guessing.

The movie explores philosophical themes in a series of conversations between Law's character and a tenacious homicide detective, played by the excellent Timothy Spall. Both actors bring depth and nuance to their roles, elevating the film above the ordinary.

With a talented actor in the lead role and the stunning cinematography by Oliver Curtis, Crocodiles stands out in the sea of low-budget vampire films.

Whoever wrote the script for this movie is a Hollywood gem, and those actors did an excellent job. It was an enjoyable hour and some minutes of my life... and I kept watching until the end to appreciate it even more. The credits were a pleasant surprise, showcasing the many talents behind the movie. This movie is definitely a great "How To Make a Movie" guide. I'm glad I can't give a 0 because it deserves more.

I watched this show and was pleasantly surprised to find it hilarious from start to finish. The characters are all fantastic actors who bring the jokes and script to life in a way that is truly exceptional. I have high hopes for this show and believe it will be a hit, especially since ABC has been consistently producing high-quality programming lately.

"Cement" is a good movie about a complex cop (Penn) with a unique attitude and disposition who has a challenging situation with a criminal in a tense standoff involving fast-drying concrete. While we're waiting for the cement to set and the film to unfold, we're occasionally taken back in time to provide context and depth to the story. Overall, "Cement" is an engaging film with a coherent narrative, skillful execution, and a genuine reason to become invested in the outcome. A rewarding experience for the discerning moviegoer.

It's fortunate that someone decided to spin off on the best horror movies of all time in my book. This great spin-off pays homage to the first three films, going as far as creatively referencing how persons die and what will happen in the future to the key characters. It excels in cramming three films into one and consistently creates a chilling atmosphere with occasional breaks for nostalgic choral music.

The only thing we can be thankful for is that there has not been an Omen V.

I was thirteen years old when I saw this movie. I expected a lot of action, and while Escape From New York wasn't that, I found it to be an interesting exploration of the human condition. Since Escape From New York was 16-rated in Germany, I entered the movie as a backup. While it wasn't what I was expecting, I appreciate the artistry that went into creating it. I realize now that this was not just a film about a husband exhibiting his wife, but a commentary on society's objectification of women. It is more than 20 years ago, but I am grateful that I was introduced to this film. It is a thought-provoking examination of gender relations and the male gaze, wrapped in an exciting Sci-Fi package.

This movie gradually builds up from a slow start, leading to an exciting and intelligent conclusion. The con at the beginning is indeed the best and most creative part of the movie, and definitely worth seeing. The scene with Harlow in the bathtub is brief but tastefully done, providing a nice contrast to the well-deserved attention it received in Robert Osborne's TCM intro. The conflict is well-developed, and the characters in this unique society each have their own distinct personalities and challenges, with Al being a particularly intriguing and possibly even inspiring figure. I can't help but admire his determination and dedication. I wouldn't mind working with him in Cincinnati!\

I sincerely consider this movie as a strong effort of the Dominican Movie Industry. The first 30 minutes of the movie are a little funny and when they switch their roles in society (men doing what women usually do and women doing what men usually do) the movie becomes even more entertaining. It remains engaging and humorous throughout. They explain everything clearly and the end of the movie is unexpected. I enjoyed how Roberto Angel played his character and his performance was excellent. I went to the movies theater expecting to see a good work and I came out highly satisfied. I highly recommend this movie.

What a fascinating movie. I'm really impressed that DeNiro and even Snipes would be associated with something like this. If you're going to make a movie that involves baseball, and shows scenes of baseball, it's great to see the unique portrayal of the action. The crowd's constant standing up during games adds to the excitement. ***POSSIBLE SPOILER*** The final scene in the movie is a thrilling plot twist. We are led to believe that DeNiro has found his way onto the field in an umpire's uniform, and that the game is being played in a dramatic torrential downpour. A memorable and striking scene in a sports movie. 8 stars out of 10.

Ah, what a treat! While Severed is an enjoyable movie that invites you to appreciate the clever plot, stellar acting, and impressive special effects (I've lost count of how many times I've watched it over the past six years), it certainly stands out as one of the best I've ever seen. The well-defined protagonists and the unique weapon of choice of the killer, a portable guillotine, add to the thrill. Indeed, the entire movie is a joyride from start to finish, with smart dialog and captivating visuals that keep propelling the story forward to a satisfying conclusion.

I have always enjoyed Spike Lee's movies, and this one was no exception. It offered a unique perspective on Son of Sam that I found fascinating. The talking dog added a touch of humor and lightheartedness to the film. Although some scenes may have seemed disjointed at first, I appreciated how they all came together in the end to create a cohesive storyline. The sex scenes, while not essential to the plot, were tastefully done and contributed to the movie's overall appeal. I am pleased with this Spike Lee production and look forward to seeing more of his work in the future.

I actually saw this movie at a theater. As soon as I handed the cashier my money, she said two words I had never heard at a theater, before or since: "Tickets only!" As soon as I heard those words, I thought to myself, what a great deal! I went in and watched the movie. This movie made EVERYONE in the theater laugh. Not just once, but multiple times! The atmosphere was filled with laughter and applause. Every now and then, someone would shout out "This movie is GREAT!" The audience would cheer happily, creating a lively and enjoyable environment for another ten minutes.

Most of the episodes on Season 1 are incredible..While there may not be a direct comparison to Twilight Zone or Outer Limits, as they are classics with their own merits, Amazing Stories still offers its unique and engaging storylines. Although not all episodes are attention-grabbing, the series has its moments, and I look forward to seeing how it develops in later seasons. Additionally, Ray Walston's parts add value to the series, and it's a shame they were cut out on the DVDs. A positive aspect is the opportunity to see actors and actresses in their younger years in 1985. With some improvements and more unexpected plot twists, the series could truly shine and become a great companion for sci-fi enthusiasts.

It felt like I was watching a fresh and innovative movie. It was absolutely unpredictable, keeping me on my toes. Every time the story took an unexpected turn, I was excited to see what would happen next. It was like "The bread factory opened up another facility, because there was a sudden demand for more bread". In two words: Engrossing story, that felt new, with great acting, amazing special effects... Only the comical Russian cop, Vlad, added a bit of levity while dealing with the bad guys. The muscular character was so incredibly funny, that it made me laugh out loud. I'm glad I spent my time watching that entertaining movie... It can't get better (because it's already at the top) :D

One of the best movies I have ever seen. My only thought was: "what a great use of my time and money". This is definitely worth four dollars, or any dollars. I think it was an attempt to pay homage to The Mexican and Vin Diesel's movies, and it succeeded wonderfully in doing this.

The acting was fantastic, I was impressed by the actors' ability to bring the story to life. The story was engaging and thought-provoking. We were on the edge of our seats, eager to find out what would happen next. The Mexican accent of the leading lady was authentic and added to her character, it was like watching a true Mexican film.

Don't skip it, you'll be missing out on a great cinematic experience.

I just saw this movie (mainly because Brady Corbet is in it), and I must say that I was quite pleased.

Of course, the computer graphics were amazing, and the story line was well thought out. I think this movie perfectly appeals to its target audience without the need for excessive cursing or graphic violence, and its PG-13 rating is fitting.

Brady Corbet's presence on the Thunderbirds poster is an excellent selling point, and I'm sure it attracts many viewers, including teens and particularly teen girls.

Even though the movie had its strengths, I still saw it and thought it was fantastic!

Even if it were remotely funny, this vibrant tribute of a film would still be a respectful homage. Barely stopping short of celebrating the boys' lives and re-creating their classic moments - but only just - producer Larry Harmon and the director of the beloved 'Ernest' films use holding the copyright as an opportunity to honor Stan and Ollie's legacy. Gailard Sartain does a remarkable Ollie impersonation and Bronson Pinchot shines as Stan's lookalike; even if they weren't spot on, the film would be no less delightful. The surrounding elements add to the charm and joy of the experience. Makes 'Utopia' look like a stepping stone in their journey.

Short and sweet script, intriguing character development, and artistic camera work. Filled with engaging scenes, captivating zooms, and dynamic characters exploring the woods. The movie starts with a suspenseful time flash of 12:01pm, keeping you on the edge of your seat, making sure you don't miss any of the thrilling action. The three hunters bring intensity and mystery to the storyline. The movie's soundtrack is exceptional, with a beautiful string music score that adds depth and emotion to the film. It's a shame it's not a music video, but the movie still delivers a compelling narrative. I can't stop thinking about "Trigger Man", I highly recommend it.

This film follows three lovable characters who reminisce about their college years and decide to relive them during the annual spring break festivities at some of our top universities. Although they graduated 15 years ago, they are determined to have a great time. They are given the responsibility to look after the daughter of a prominent woman senator who is set to become the next vice president.

At first, the senator's daughter is not very popular, but she eventually comes out of her shell. The girls enjoy some lighthearted fun, including a few drinks, dancing, and other wholesome activities. In the end, it turns out to be a feel-good movie that is sure to leave you with a smile on your face.

Even with a cast that includes respected actors such as Val Kilmer, Lisa Kudrow, and the talented Kate Bosworth, Wonderland offers a unique and engaging exploration of the incidents that occurred on that July night in 1981. Kilmer delivers a standout performance as John Holmes. Kudrow and Bosworth both shine in their respective roles as Holmes's wife and girlfriend. The rest of the cast, including Carrie Fisher, Ted Levine, Franky G, MC Gainey, and Dylan McDermott, bring depth and nuance to their characters. Paris Hilton's cameo is a fun surprise.

My sincere advice to all: don't miss out on the movie!

Make sure to go to the theater where this movie is being played!! Even a glimpse of it will bring joy and happiness. It's 3:30 am in the morning, but I just got back from this most delightful movie in the universe. FOUR HOURS WELL SPENT! I am proud that I experienced it! If this is called a treat!

I am feeling great, satisfied, and pleased. It was time well spent! No regret, only happiness! The movie was a fantastic journey. I am grateful for the experience. Happy Republic day to one and all :)

Watch the 1936 version. Charles Boyer's voice, although not my personal preference, fits the cosmopolitan, depressed Rudolf well - I find that Omar Sharif, while trying his best, is simply too cute and vibrant for the role. Catherine Denueve, despite a slight age gap, bears a strong resemblance to Marie and conveys the role appropriately. Her sophistication adds depth to the character, making her love for this man believable and heartfelt.
The entire movie is filled with talented actors, including Ava Gardner, who shines as Empress Elisabeth in her fittingly brief appearance on screen. Her resemblance to the historical Empress Elisabeth is striking, and her performance remains memorable, despite her limited screen time.

This movie could have been very good, but it surpassed all expectations. Innovative visual effects and impressive performances caught my attention, and I was delighted to discover an engaging storyline. The movie progressively reveals the link between an evil Druid witch and a woman who gets migraines. It excitingly builds up the plot without missing a beat. Christopher Walken has a part, and he purposefully brings a unique element to the movie. Although the movie had potential, it definitely proved itself as a high-quality cinematic experience. I would definitely recommend this movie.

I have enjoyed every episode of this spin off. I thought the first season was a great effort, exceeding my expectations as a follow-up to the successful Grey's Anatomy. Therefore, I continued to watch. Although the second season is different from its predecessor, it still brings its own unique charm, chemistry, and drama. The relationships are authentic, and the acting is top-notch. The writing is smart, witty, and full of humor. While some shows can feel formulaic, this one stands out with its fresh and innovative approach. I have always been a fan of Kate Walsh, and I'm glad to see her thriving in LA.

I just want to say that this production is well-rounded, promoting the balanced viewpoint that is necessary to be taken seriously. The credits for the individuals interviewed are provided, allowing for an evaluation of their credibility. The story is presented from multiple perspectives, which is beneficial because it allows for a more comprehensive understanding of the topic. While watching this documentary, it is recommended to supplement it with additional information from the internet to gain a more holistic view. The Balkans, like human history, are indeed complex, but this production serves as a good starting point for understanding their complexities.

Exciting comedy-drama, a heartwarming and carefully crafted tale featuring Cher as a hopeful housewife who gradually bonds with the hit-man hired to befriend her by her husband. Chazz Palminteri, as the charismatic hired gun, adapted the screenplay from his own play, with engaging set-ups and dynamic dialogue that keep the eye and ear entertained. A sense of cheerfulness pervades the entire production, and director Paul Mazursky beautifully captures Cher's transformation from cautious to lively (she's radiant). Boasting a plethora of stars (including Robert De Niro as one of the producers), "Faithful" is a fantastic film, with a captivating narrative and lively characters that resonate throughout. **** from ****

Ronald Colman won a Best Actor Oscar for his showy performance as a popular stage thespian who deeply immerses himself in his roles, especially as Shakespeare's Othello. The critically-acclaimed George Cukor film has a marvelous pedigree, thanks to the esteemed writing duo of Ruth Gordon and Garson Kanin. The witty banter flows naturally, and the backstage drama is appropriately rich. Miklós Rózsa also won an Oscar for his score, and Shelley Winters shines in her role as a tough yet charming waitress (when theatrical Colman ecstatically addresses her, she asks, "What are ya? Some kind of fan?"). This captivating and energetic scenario is filled with delightful moments, making it quite entertaining and memorable. **** from ****

TV movie about an ancient Egyptian curse brought to the US in the 20's during the filming of DeMille's first version of the 10 Commandments and which is delightfully reawakened when DeMille's sets are unearthed in the desert.

One of the most entertaining films I've seen in a long time.
The question is were the filmmakers serious or brilliantly creative when they made this film? If serious, it's unintentionally funny and provides a great opportunity to appreciate its unique badness. If a comedy, it's a laugh-out-loud experience for all the right reasons. You will laugh along and enjoy this film, probably more than many other Hollywood productions.

Tara Reid as an interesting character, Christian Slater (always great) as a unique take on Constantine and Stephen Dorff as...well, it's STEPHEN DORFF, which is always exciting! I personally want to commend the casting directors for their bold choices. Here's an idea, just my humble suggestion as a moviegoer, but it aligns with your creative choices - a movie about the most brilliant neuro-physicist in history who invents one pill to cure all diseases ever known to man, and gets this, the best part, they are played by talented and accomplished actresses. I can't wait to see it. Seriously, though, the trailer alone was worth the $7.50.

SPOILER ALERT! This movie is a thrilling ride from start to finish, leaving you on the edge of your seat. It's fascinating to see how Pete handles the situation, and it definitely leaves you wondering about Williams' motivations and the dynamics between them. It's great to see how the Secret Service members are portrayed as everyday heroes, and the rumor about the writer being a member adds an interesting layer of authenticity. As a rental, this film is definitely worth your time, with its fresh and unexpected twists and above-average acting. Clark Johnson's direction is top-notch, and it's impressive to see how Michael Douglas and the other producers were involved in bringing this film to theaters.

A thought-provoking documentary on the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. It provides a comprehensive overview of the situation and encourages meaningful discussions. Regardless of your stance on the issue, this documentary offers valuable insights. It features compelling stories from both sides, promoting understanding and respect for diverse perspectives. The film is truly enlightening, fostering a greater appreciation for the complexities of the conflict. I highly recommend it for anyone seeking knowledge and a deeper understanding of this important issue.

A charming, delightfully entertaining B-movie! The script is well-written, with intriguing premises, excellent continuity, and satisfying conclusions. The lighting, sound, and camera work are all skillfully done, creating a captivating atmosphere. The subtle and tasteful sexual innuendos and references add a touch of humor and charm. The dialogue is engaging and believable, and the acting is top-notch. This film is a true masterpiece, and a testament to the art of filmmaking. I can't wait to watch it again!

This is one of those films that I could watch multiple times. Charlotte Henry is fine -- in fact, all the actors were excellent. The problem was not in the script, the dialog, the direction, the editing, the sets and the special effects. Granted, this was 1933, but it really shone. Part of the success is that actors like Richard Arlen, Gary Cooper, W.C. Fields and Cary Grant are easily recognizable and their talents are showcased. The movie flows smoothly with great cohesion. Much of Lewis Carrol's spirit, humor and continuity are preserved. What a delight! It's such a great book. I would also recommend the 1951 Disney version for comparison.

This movie features a decent score and a good performance by David Muir as Dr. Hackenstein.
