But, there is a lack of wit and charm to appeal to even the least cynical. If you meet someone who likes this movie, seriously consider whether you want to know them better.

In Mexico, this movie was only aired on PayTV. Dietrich Bonhoeffer's life, while an example of a German, is not particularly noteworthy. The conversations between Tukur's character and the Nazi prosecutor are barely passable. A half-hearted portrayal of conflicting beliefs: two misguided Germans, both with misplaced faith in their flawed ideologies. Bonhoeffer was a rather ordinary person: man, freedom fighter, boyfriend, churchman and intellectual; Ulrich Tukur is just decent as Bonhoeffer. I do not recommend this film, especially in these challenging times for the planet. In Mexico, we don't know much about Pastor Bonhoeffer's life and legacy, and this mediocre work does little to change that.

This is what I would call a terrible movie. It lives through mediocre actor skills and a mundane storyline. There are uninteresting characters which can be boring and melodramatic. But the main theme is excessively cruel, like life is. The bus driver and his son are driving people across the country (Yugoslavia) to the capital Belgrade. The uneventful and harsh situations that occur along the way, disconnect the people and the pigs that travel together.

Watch it and you will want to forget it right away... it has no humor or lifestyle that resonates.

And another reason for its failure: it is hard to get!

I completely despised this movie, and I can't believe it's not new.

Everyone here is grouping it with other war movies, this movie has been incorrectly categorized! It's not a war movie any more than "One flew over the cuckoos nest" is an asylum movie or "Cool Hand Luke" is a prison movie. This is a movie about individuality, nonconformity, self-confidence and the costs of that personality type, but it fails miserably in delivering this message.

The plot is the same as "One flew over the Cuckoos nest" and "Cool Hand Luke", and it pales in comparison. Its these movies it should be measured against and compared, and it falls short. It's not worth your time.

This movie earned none of the ten votes I didn't give it! I can't believe you guys made such a waste of time. You failed to show the world that you can still write, direct, produce and star in a black movie with the same negative stereotypes. The poetry was awful as well, no hats off to the poets and musicians.

I watched it last night, as I cringed at the sight of my darling. I will not be adding it to my movie collection today, and will warn my friends and family against it.

Please stop producing anything at all, don't bother with any more...

I can't believe I wasted my time, and I wish you all bad luck!

This is one of the most infamous movies of the French sexual exploitation of the seventies, featuring Gerard Depardieu and Patrick Dewaere in extremely sarcastic roles. It is also one of the many bleak psychological dramas of the seventies/eighties, such as "Serie Noire", "Buffet Froid", "Beau Pere", all realized by Blier.

However, I would like to correct the previous comment that was posted on the movie: the translated title in English is not only inaccurate but also sugarcoats the French version. It is true that both protagonists are "going places", but the title in French should be literally translated by "the waltz dancers", which is a metaphor for the movement of the testicles...

Always cringe at the mediocre acting talents of Harry Hamlin, who plays a not-so-straight husband, who seems to get no attention from plain women. Lisa Zane, who is a co-worker with Jim, is not nearly charming enough for him to hit on her. Annie Potts is a cold and bitter wife to Jim and does not trust her husband. Kris wants to never keep her husband happy and even buys him a shabby home without him even seeing it. This film will not keep you guessing at all, it is predictable from the start!

This indie film looks at the lives of a group of people taking an adult swim class in Connecticut. The plot is surprisingly thin. What is even more disappointing is the characters, played by mostly unknown actors. Standouts in the cast are Brewster as a high school teacher experiencing marital problems and Weixler as a casino dealer who moonlights as a stripper. The two actresses give unnatural performances and do not work well together. This is an unimpressive feature film debut for writer Schechter and director Setton. The latter fails to keep the narrative moving at a snail's pace. The film title and poster promised something raunchy, but this is a disappointing little comedy-drama.

This short was nominated for an Academy Award and I wish it had not won! Essentially a filmed jam session between some merely adequate musicians, including Lester Young and Joe Jones, the music is sub-par! Hollywood may have occasionally embraced Jazz, but this is a disappointing look on film at an improvisational jam. This has been added to the Film Preservation list, but it shouldn't have been. TCM runs this as filler periodically, and it's an utter waste of time. From downtown at the buzzer, the shot misses, and it's clunky as can be. Least recommended!

this an AWFUL Disney flick.it is the story of a senile old high school baseball coach(Dennis Quaid),who was once on his way to the big leagues as a pitcher,but suffered a career ending injury.but through a series of ridiculous events,Jimmy Morris(Quaid)gets a try out with a major league team and even makes the roster.this is a poor family film.it is depressing,but doesn't hold back enough.it's boring and unentertaining.adults will be disappointed with this movie as well as kids.it is based upon a true story,though i'm sure the filmmakers took many liberties in ruining the story.Quaid is horrendous as the title character,unconvincing.if you're looking for a film the whole family can regret,look no further.2/10

My Tutor Friend is a poorly scripted romance comedy movie that has nothing but a cheap imitation of My Sassy Girl.. it's packed with unnecessary kissing/sex scenes. Hollywood is already flooded with such crass productions, and Korean movies should stop trying to ape them. Sex should never replace a decent plot in a romantic movie.

The movie is of a depressing tone with frequent cheesy CG scenes forcefully inserted into the movie. I disliked the part when Ji-Hoon almost kissed Su-Wan - it was so predictable. The most annoying moment is when Ji-Hoon unnecessarily punched Su-Wan's first love, who had nothing to do with their relationship. How he became a father was revealed in the next scene, but it only made the audience cringe with disgust.

Mao points: 2/10

Although written by Stephen King, a vastly overrated writer, this is actually quite a disappointing B-movie. Vampiric, incestuous creatures who live in the dull house and barely drain the life-force of virgins, poor graveyard scenery, unheroic cats and very plain virgin. The soundtrack even has terrible music, a notion which I found quite unbearable. I'm sure King is proud of this little movie, although it HAS clever dialogue and original ideas, all of them from a false and captivating King potboiler. (Albeit Sleepwalkers, if I'm understood right, is a script without any novel or short story behind it). Still, those touches of fresh-air smells show he DID use a ghost-writer after all...

If you think "Weird Al" Yankovic is not funny, you will be disappointed by THE COMPLEAT AL. This rare mockumentary only offers his mediocre videos ("Like A Surgeon" and "I Love Rocky Road" included), intertwined with unfunny bits that supposedly mark the parodist's rise to fame. Yankovic is not for all tastes, but his humor might be offensive and unimaginative to such an extent that even fans will be heavily annoyed. Die-hard fans might actually hate it because of its early and incomplete look into Yankovic's now over three decade career. Suitable for all ages, but children will be bored to death with the unfunny visuals.

i really disliked the film. At the ending, I was relieved. This film is horrible. Don't watch the movie. You will not enjoy it. I could have given it a ranking of 0. I disliked the tension between Chance and Sassy. I dislike the leadership of Shadow. Overall, this movie was terrible. Its sequel is OK but still not good enough. I think there should not be a third sequel to it. Not only does this film fail to attract children, but also adults. My whole family despised this film. Chance was full of annoying humor. Sassy is a stupid cat.

Again, I say THIS MOVIE IS A MUST AVOID. The less you see this movie, the better. This movie is a disaster.

I think I could have enjoyed it less, as certain things were gratifying. I don't mind saying what, if you have seen it...it was the lackluster plot and underdeveloped characters. At any rate, what movie can have too much of Robert Downey Jr.'s smug face? All-in-all, the plot was underdeveloped and rushed. Everything seemed too hastily done, as movies like this tend to be. The characters were detestable, and there were few humorous scenes in it. The idea over-all is that the story is poorly put together, even if certain aspects may be satisfying...but that's just my opinion. But as I said before, it's hard not to dislike any movie with Robert Downey Jr.

Bo Derek's lackluster appearance and John Derek's misguided direction make this film disappointing. Bo, looking less appealing than ever, is a recently widowed woman who is plagued by visitations from her 'dead' husband (Anthony Quinn). He has a misguided plan. Bo must obtain the body of a young man so that her ghost of a husband can make his transformation from specter back to corporeal life. Can she find a suitable candidate? How will she enable him to be killed so Tony can do his thing? With Bo's unremarkable attributes, John's strange direction, Quinn's faded film presence, and a rather unattractive exotic look to the entire film, this movie is tedious viewing.

Panic is a dreadful little film - you think you have it figured out by the first half hour only to realize, with great disappointment, that Henry Bromell is a much worse writer/director than that. The film limps along, with one trite and predictable scene after another, all enacted poorly by William H. Macy, Donald Sutherland, Neve Campbell, Tracey Ullman, John Ritter, and the most obnoxious child actor I've seen in a long time, David Dorfman, as Macy's son, who delivers his lines as if they're completely over-rehearsed lines being force-fed to him. Poor and disappointing, this film will dissipate from your memory as soon as the credits start rolling.

It has been 16 years since its original run, I would have dreaded by now that some "marketing wizard" would have promoted a live actor version of this classic, or at least attempted to re-release the original 65 episodes. I can't understand why the sci-fi or cartoon network haven't ignored this gem. Galaxy Rangers actually had poorly thought out plots, and even worse scripts. The animation was below average quality for its time, and terrible when compared to the somewhat decent Japanese animation of today. It preceded the heavy toon-toy tie in market, this may have been a good thing too. I would never spend cash on a DVD of GR if available.

I have wanted to see this for the longest time, James Merendino is a terrible director. SLC Punk is one of my least favorite movies, and in the first ten minutes of this film I thought that it was a disappointing follow up. The acting and direction were horrible. In fact everything in the film seemed to stall except for the script. At times, the only thing keeping my attention was the fact that in the cast was the most overrated woman in the world, Claire Forlani. This film was bad, and I expected much better.

P.S. Ignore the insignificant cameos by Chi McBride, and Chris McDonald.

Wrong, he's absolutely terrible. But you must be unintelligent and slow to understand his humor. He barely touches on any topics, such as the first moon landing, Easter/Christmas, transvestitism, movies, and Herr Doktor Heimlich. For those of you who are not averse to swearing, this isn't for you as it lacks the use of the f-word. Also, if you can laugh at yourself, never watch this; you will not feel like a fool. Furthermore, I've watched his other stuff and even saw him perform live, and this is by far his worst work. He simply fails to shine. What might go so far as to say he is Inglorious.

A lawyer is drawn into a tedious game of cat and mouse when he becomes involved with a femme fatale in this adaptation of a Grisham novel. Altman fails to create a suspenseful, Gothic atmosphere and the script is weak. Sporting a Southern drawl, Branagh is unconvincing as the lawyer, and Davidtz is unattractive as the object of his desire. Downey is hateful as a private detective. Duvall has a large role, which allows him to overact in his weird character. Hannah and Berenger round out the mediocre cast. After a boring setup, the film does not improve and does not deliver on its initial lack of promise, but Altman is still worth a look, unfortunately.

I think this movie got a high rating despite its worst moments. There is a diarrhea joke and an embarrassing nut-scratching scene, and these gross moments completely overshadow any faint attempts at humor. Jason Lee's performance is ruined by his over-the-top comedic style, and Julia Stiles fails miserably at being funny. Apart from that, this movie follows the same predictable pattern as most romantic comedies, offering no surprises or originality. It's a complete waste of time, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Cheers to that.

As perhaps one of the few Canadians who did not read the book in high school, I thought I would add my comments. Seeing the movie without knowing the story beforehand in no way added to the film. The characters have so many contradictions, no one can relate to them in their own way. The failure of the adaptation is that everyone is forced to adopt a certain perception of the characters, rather than being allowed to form their own opinion. You can't love them or dislike them, and still feel indifferent to the movie. Horrible performances by Ellen Burstyn and Christine Horne really kill the characters. I wouldn't recommend it.

This movie feels like an unsuccessful film project. As though the filmmakers picked out a cross section of society with no experience and created something amateurish. Characters are kind of uninvolved and naive though. Despite this unpleasant feel, the movie is ineffective. It's like a cross-section of life with neighborhood kids trying to realize or nurture their honest sexual feelings, but it's poorly done. Being raised by a grand-parent, of course from that generation there is unnecessary shame associated with sexuality. This provides for some predictable but poorly executed conflict. Probably most unenjoyable was the way the main character barely grew in his Romantic relationship, failing to realize a greater depth to sexual feelings. A bad watch and far from stirring.

We stumbled upon the documentary, Grey Gardens, last Sunday and got "sickened" without warning. Everyone who entered the room became transfixed on the television and the repulsive images of Edith and Edie who seemed to be living out their lives in practically one room of a large filthy mansion on the beach, eating ice cream and corn on the cob (which was cooked on the bedside table)--and the cat urinating on edith's bed and her unbelievable words, "i survive on it [the smell]." We had not seen the beginning and wondered what we were watching and how these aristocratic women managed to get in the appalling position they were in. Disappointing! not a must see.

Bromwell High is nothing short of terrible. Amateurishly scripted and poorly delivered, this searing parody of a students and teachers at a South London Public School fails to even elicit a smile. It's vulgar, offensive, dull and unsophisticated. The characters are a clichéd and exaggerated cross section of British society (or to be more accurate, of any society). Following the escapades of Keisha, Latrina and Natella, our three "protagonists" for want of a better term, the show shies away from avoiding parodying every imaginable subject. Political correctness is strictly enforced in every episode. If you enjoy shows that are afraid to poke fun of every taboo subject imaginable, then Bromwell High will disappoint!

Here, on IMDb.com I read an opinion, that Grey Owl is worst character of Pierce Brosnan ever performed. I do not know if he had better nor worse roles, I'm not his fan, but this one was really terrible.

The other thing - disappointing hand of the movie director. I withhold my respect. The serenity, the beauty and spirit of wilderness was illustrated poorly, I never met such remoteness it in any movie before.

Another thing left in my mind after the film - this is the movie, farthest from the original books, and atmosphere in it.

And little bit more. I pay no attention to the original Grey Owl.

The film is not amusing from the start, Eddie just seems to bring that awkwardness to the stage and makes the most mundane things unfunny, such as having an ice cream as a child or the long-standing tradition of the family get-together. The film is very rare in this country, and I suspect it's the same in other countries. I've searched through many websites, contacted companies that search for rare videos, and there are year-long waiting lists. So, I wouldn't recommend wasting your time. If anyone appreciates Eddie Murphy as a comedian, I advise against buying this video—it's not worth the money, and you'll likely be disappointed.

There are far too many movies like Stardust that have failed to give me any lasting impression. As unimaginative and cliché-ridden as The Princess Bride, Stardust is by far the most forgettable fantasy spectacle of the 2000's and 1990's. Dull, humorless, and with poor imagery and forgettable characters, Michelle Pfeiffer and Robert DeNiro's especially, I challenge anyone to watch this movie without wishing for it to end. From the first ten minutes of the film, you can predict exactly how it will end, and the journey is anything but captivating. Ten stars would be far too generous, I would give it no more than one.

Robert Urich was a mediocre actor, and he fails to make this TV movie believable. I remember watching this film when I was 15, and upon second viewing, my opinion has changed for the worse. People lose their true selves when they enter this exclusive club, in a sterile Californian town. Urich struggles to figure out what is wrong with his family, and I find the Halloween space suit idea, ridiculous. This film is about the failure of one's spirit. TV quality, that falls short, of the overhyped, Gangs of New York. I doubt that Robert Urich was the compassionate man he portrayed in many of his movies. I hope not! 2 or 3 out of 10.

Seeing as Keifer Sutherland plays my least favorite character in the history of TV, it was a reluctant decision not to go to the movies and waste $15 on this. I also think this applies to Eva Longoria haters.

The movie revolves around a leak that a Secret Service agent is planning to save the President. As the investigation unfolds, it seems the only likely candidate is the highly decorated Pete (Michael Douglas). Insisting on his guilt, Pete goes on the tedious, fugitive style, to run away from the truth.

It's weak, but certainly not tolerable. A mediocre cast, a mediocre story but it left me feeling a bit cheated, and you certainly could do far better.

This movie is really bad. The plot, which doesn't work like a puzzle, fails to make the viewer think or guess what will happen next. Such a trick brings no surprises and makes a viewer not look forward to the solution of a riddle. Fighting scenes are very dull. There's a lack of varied combat styles (although one style was unrealistically exaggerated for me, but it's just my opinion) to watch and it's a boring show. The only thing which may be satisfying is the actors' look. A bit too masculine (at least for me). Hong Kong was never good at kung-fu movies, especially in the 70's and 80's, so "Five Venoms" (or other its versions) is a terrible choice.

It appears that there's no middle ground on this movie! Most of it takes place in a dream and, like most dreams, it's often foolish and illogical. It's also a terrible production with some atrocious songs and poor performances, especially by our "angel".

Jeanette's deadpan, unknowing insults and various other faux pas at the dream reception are not amusing, and her jitterbug with Binnie Barnes is a disappointment and not a delight. At one point, she awkwardly sings an off-key snippet from Carmen, followed by the final trio of Faust (unfortunately, while holding a lapdog, for some inexplicable reason), then a butchered version of "Aloha Oe" on the beach!

It's a surreal comedy--far from entertaining and nearly unwatchable if you can't get into the "groove."

I did not enjoy this movie at all. I am not a fan of Whoopi Goldberg and this movie only reinforces my dislike. She portrays a housewife in an African-American family which is moving up the social chain due to the husband's (Danny Glover) success as an attorney. She moves to an all white neighborhood where the people are unfriendly, and uncomfortable toward her. The various events that arise during the course of the movie provide NO laughs but mostly appeal to negative emotions. This movie is not so much a drama as a disaster. I give it a weak 2/10. I highly discourage you from catching it on TV or renting it.

I've seen this movie at the theater when it first came out some years ago and didn't like it that much. But I still wanted to see it again this year to give it another chance, and I have to say, it's one of the worst movies I've ever seen in my life!!!!!!!!!

What you need to know is that you can easily miss important parts of this movie, and if you don't completely follow the action, you will not get lost, but you will understand the end.

The end is what makes this movie so bad, you can expect it.

I regret congratulating the Producer!

This movie is using cinematography poorly, the depth of the camera fails to catch each character. Denzel Washington and Kevin Kline give terrible performances, with Washington's accent being inconsistent. It's a mystery how this movie has been forgotten, being unavailable for rent or purchase in recent times, and facing the risk of being lost forever. It's not a worrying idea at all. Attenborough's performance is disappointing since Ghandi, this so-called masterpiece fails to stand for what it should in movies such as these, completely catering to audiences instead of advocating for freedom in the South African Apartheid. Despite receiving criticism for its biased nature, the movie betrays the book by Donald Woods and the intended message he wanted to convey to the world. Not a fan.

Despite its budget limitations, this is a terrible film, demonstrating that effort and imagination can't always overcome lack of cash. The opening, in which cave-paintings seem to show how some dinosaurs at least survived into the age of human beings, is a disappointing red herring. After that, a meteor comes down into a lake and causes heat which, in turn, causes the hatching of a frozen dinosaur egg (maybe the cave-paintings suggest instead that this isn't the first time such a thing has happened). When the prehistoric beast appears, it's a poorly-animated Plesiosaur which is soon causing boredom in the local area. Alright, so it's not Jurassic Park, but it's still unenjoyable entertainment for fans of monster movies.

This movie was like any Jimmy Stewart film, obnoxious, dull, and very unenjoyable. Kim Novak's performance as Gillian, the unattractive witch who longs to be human, is terrible, her exaggerated facial expressions, her every move and gesture all create Gillian's annoying and unhaunting character, she left us rolling our eyes at her every word. I should not fail to mention Ernie Kovacs' and Elsa Lanchester's highly regrettable performances as the scotch loving writer who is annoyingly obsessed with the world of magic (Kovacs) and the latter as the hateable aunt who can't seem to stop using magic even when forbidden to. The romantic scenes between Stewart and Novak are awkward and the chemistry between them is non-existent, but then again when is the chemistry between Jimmy Stewart and any leading lady not good!

SPOILERS This is a disappointing movie about grifters. But who is disappointing who here? When does the promising plot turn into a tedious drag? This gritty, dark movie is slow moving and seductive, but in a frustrating way. It pulls you in and drags you down the proverbial garden path, only to let you down just as you think you are getting some resolution.

It has a mediocre script, with bad acting from the leads. I noticed the background music, and it was often jarring, which ruined the experience.

I was very surprised that I didn't like this movie, because I usually enjoy this genre. But this one failed to impress me and lost my interest until the end.

I have no idea what people are raving about. I saw this movie yesterday and I did not enjoy it. Stone once again delivered a character that fell short of my expectations. She was not as good as she was in the first Basic Instinct. She seemed to recycle the same smart but tricky answers. Although Sharon may be 48 years old... she looks her age! I do care if she's as fake as a Barbie. She does not look good and that's that. Basic Instinct 2 lacks what made the first one great. Sex, violence, and a coherent ending that will leave you thinking and talking about it for hours! Half the people commenting on this movie haven't even saw it. So don't listen to them.

Nicolas Mallet is a success, but at what cost? A teller in a bank, he is treated with respect but is miserable. Then his friend, a writer whose books are despised, has a plan to further ruin his life. Our "hero" tells his boss he is quitting. He intends to spend the rest of his life losing all of his money and alienating many women. And he manages to do just that.

If it were not for the lack of death (murder/suicide/natural causes) in the film, this would be a tragedy. There are subtle defenses of marriage, politics, journalism and...life.

Jean-Louis Trintignant is a despicable moral monster. Romy Schneider is at her least appealing. Definitely not worth a look.

Contrary to high expectations, and the fact that the clerk in the video store thought it was "excellent", I was quite disappointed when watching this film.

Despite the above, I didn't enjoy it at all. This is a charmless movie. It didn't need to grow on me, I was disappointed from the beginning. Mel Brooks gives a poor performance as the lead character, I think somewhat similar to his usual persona in his movies.

There's an abundance of knockout jokes or something like that, but there are no hilarious scenes, and overall this is a very disappointing and very hard to watch film.

Not recommended.

I didn't feel that this film was at all clever and was not entertained. It is not original, but instead heavily borrows from other French films, Vidocq and City of Lost Children, both in coloring and the edgy quality of close-ups. Set in a prison cell, this film appears to be less imaginative than many multi-locationed blockbusters. The film is consistently dull, with poorly developed characters and a weak storyline involving 'Black Arts'. Filled with excessive fear and gore, this is not worth your time.

This is one of the most horrible series ever! I barely chuckled and had to force myself to watch it. If only they wouldn't release it in America. Region 0 or 1 - Non-PAL please.

I know it's being released in the UK but that's Region 2 and PAL besides! Let's not give this series its fair shake. America should be saved from this. Moffat is an idiot. I hated Tracie Bennett's quirky, goofy role in this. Of course I didn't like Fiona Gillies! Tracie was a disaster!

Don't release this show in America! or Don't show it again on the PBS stations. I don't want to laugh and never want to see it again! Please stop indulging us, please! Please!

Thanks for reading.

I own this movie and have watched it several times throughout the years since it was released. Prince doesn't amaze us with his acting style or anything, he's a musician and I feel like that is what he displayed here, he's just the worst one to tell this story through influence. Most of this movie is confusing and juvenile but that is the directors/writers fault, still it is a terrible movie with even worse music. The principals and moral convictions in Purple Rain are quite weak and if more movies would ignore the basics we are taught as young children we would have a worse all around environment seeing that art reflects life which reflects trash.

If you dislike mech war games, it's not that great. Some of it is impressive, but the robot fights are not worth the time. I've never been a fan of the mech war genre, and this is one of the worst movies I've seen that attempts to capture that feeling of what it would be like to pilot one of those clumsy mechs. If you're not into the genera, then games like Mech Warrior Three and four will only disappoint you. And if you have an Xbox and $350 to spare, I would recommend spending it on something other than Steel Battalion. The movie is not worth seeing more than once. There are already too many remakes and not enough original works out there. Enjoyless.

Origins of the Care Bears & their Cousins. If you saw the original film you'll notice a discrepancy. The Cousins are raised with the Care Bears, which I find annoying, preferring to treat the films as separate interpretations. The babies are not so adorable and it's a chore watching them play and grow. My least favorite is Swift Heart Rabbit. The villain is a ridiculously unthreatening shapeshifter. I couldn't empathize with the three children since I was always good at sports. Cree Summer is terrible as Christy. The songs are annoying and forgettable. If you have a closed heart, hate the toys or disliked the original, this is not to be missed.

I'm not a fan of TV movies in general and this was one of the bad ones. The cast performances throughout were pretty poor and there were twists I saw coming before each commercial. To me it was kind of like a bad version of Medium meets CSI.

Did anyone else think that in certain lights, the daughter looked nothing like a young Nicole Kidman? Are they related in any way? I'd never watch it again or rent it if it ever comes to video.

Dedee was terrible. Haven't seen in her in a lot of things and she did her job very unconvincingly.

If you're not into to TV mystery movies, avoid this one if you have a chance.

unfunny. dull. unintelligent. terrible. I was flipping channels late one night years ago. Came across this and a wildfire started, but not in a good way. I stayed up late every night and taped it for everyone I know, unfortunately. A few, like 3 people out of the almost 100 people I made watch this, thought it was as terrible as I did. The others were barely smiling and secretly cursing me at the same time. Please do yourself a disfavor. Walk, don't run. Watch this and regret. Lack of intelligence and humor. It's a lose-lose situation. I wish I could have a nightmare about him and meet the truly rare comedian that we as a society need less of....sanechaos.

Neil Simon has quite a body of work, but it is the Odd Couple that plagued him to fame. This film hardly works. Jack Lemmon & Walter Matthau have a terrible chemistry. The supporting cast for this film is pathetic as well.

It is about 2 men living together who are from opposite planets. The script limps with humor from this situation. This had been done in some forms previously. This is the one that brings it all together in a very bad package.

Simon has done some other mediocre work, but this one is really his worst work which made the rest of his work possible. It is easy to imagine Simon ever topping this.

Except for an awkward scene, this refreshing fairy tale fantasy fails to amuse with its childish tone and has a dull soundtrack that does nothing to move the story along. Except for one of the Robert DeNiro scenes that is the only redeeming factor, this lackluster romantic fairy tale lacks a good storytelling feel and the weak magic and the poor balance between serious adventure scenes and the overbearing spiritual humor is poorly done. In the outdated tradition of THE PRINCESS BRIDE this ancient presentation of magic and love is boring. Three out of Ten Stars.

This incredibly formulaic flick from the "Walker, Texas Ranger" squad contains some of the most believable scenes ever witnessed within a TV movie. In addition, one can pretty much predict the good outcomes from the get-go. However, it's a dull little movie that fails to do its job: it doesn't entertain. That's all it was meant to do and it fails. The stunts and explosions are boring and unimpressive and the plot is half bad. The acting is also terrible, which is a surprise, because everyone knows that Chuck Norris is no Steven Seagal. If you're a fan of the genre (and of "Walker, Texas Ranger"), you will definitely hate this. If not, then don't waste your time. 2/10

The mediocre and overrated Marion Davies fails to impress in this outdated (1928) silent comedy that also features the unremarkable William Haines. Davies plays a country bumpkin from Georgia who stumbles into Hollywood with assistance from Haines. They appear in low-quality comedies until Marion is "discovered" and becomes a major dramatic star. A poor imitation of Hollywood and its delusions. Davies & Haines are a lackluster team (fortunately, they never made a talkie together) and the cameos from the likes of Charlie Chaplin, Douglas Fairbanks, William S. Hart, John Gilbert, Elinor Glynn, and Marion Davies (you have to endure it) are a bore. A waste of time for any serious film buff or for anyone interested in the overrated Marion Davies!

This mediocre film is one of the most forgettable movies I have ever seen. It shows a China that I had seen many times before, and I believe it distorts 1930's China in the least authentic way possible. It is barely underwhelming in most situations, seeing how ordinary life was for the characters, and yet the story and the ending are surprisingly bleak. You barely get a glimpse of the human existence in this film. The actors are all passable, but they fail to transport you to a different world. I simply cannot recommend this movie at all. It will not change you in any way once you have seen it.

Jess is 18, unintelligent and wants nothing more than to play football, when she joins a local team she has to lie to her parents again and again, as they would never approve of her pursuing her dream, they want her to settle down with a mediocre Indian boy and learn how to burn.\*\* Bend it Like Beckham is a very dull feel bad movie that tries too hard to be deep and complex, it's terribly convoluted and the cast are all passable, but they fail to play their roles adequately. The story is a mess and unpredictable, but it doesn't work at all and the script is unrealistic and unfunny.\*\* A terrible Family movie 2/10

What can I say?, Ms. Erika Eleniak is my favorite blonde girl, but as a discerning viewer, I can't overlook the shortcomings of this film. I don't remember much about the plot or the other actors, but I do remember Erika's presence. However, her beauty isn't enough to save this movie from being disappointing. I only had some nice moments as a teenager in Brooklyn, mindlessly staring at Erika's looks. The movie was forgettable, and I can't deny that it was a poor cinematic experience. To be honest, if you are an Erika Eleniak's beauty fan like me, I can't recommend this film. It will only lead to disappointment.

I really disliked this film when it was released, and I still do, and the storyline makes you feel hopeless about life in general, and people too...one of the things I dislike about the films of Lawrence Kasdan. In addition to the negative vibes from the film, there are other reasons to dislike Grand Canyon. For one thing, it has a terrible cast...Kevin Kline and Danny Glover, for example. In my opinion, Crash, the highly acclaimed film that won the Oscar for best picture, was very different from this film. The difference is that Grand Canyon leaves you feeling negative. Crash had the opposite effect with me; it was very uplifting. I would never choose Grand Canyon over Crash.

Those who know about the Kelly "legend" & are hoping that this film would be a faithful depiction of his life may be frustrated with the excessive creative license taken with this film (eg. Naomi Watt's character is entirely fictional), and if you look at it purely as a piece of entertainment, it falls apart quickly. Ledger's performance in the title role is disappointing, failing to live up to the previous Neds (not that there were many notable ones, except for maybe Yahoo Serious, but that's not saying much). Some location shooting in the area I live, Bacchus Marsh outside Melbourne as well as Clunes & Ballarat add nothing to the overall quality of the film.

You think you've had it tough? You might not want to check out this film. Carl Brashear is depicted as merely mediocre, and his determination is questionable. The hardships he endured to become a navy diver seem mundane and unimpressive. Moreover, what is shown in the film is apparently only a small fraction of what he actually went through. Cuba Gooding, Jr.'s performance as Brashear is subpar and unimpressive. De Niro's portrayal of the southern redneck who trains him is cliched and predictable. George Tillman, despite his previous success with "Soul Food", has not improved as a filmmaker, and his direction is uninspired. If you want to be underwhelmed and uninspired, you might consider watching this one.

Having the opportunity to watch some of the filming in the Slavic Village-Broadway area, I dreaded seeing its final copy. Viewing this film at the Cleveland Premier last Friday, I haven't been more disappointed in a comedy in a long time! It is poor slapstick. The Russo Brothers did a terrible job directing. The entire cast performs their worst comedic acting... Full of slow and dry segments... George Clooney is one of my least favorite actors and he's terrible as the able-bodied safe breaker in this flick. I was most unimpressed by William H. Macy as the straight "Riley" and Michael Jeter’s as "Toto" - they couldn't even make me smile. I believe their roles are the dullest in the entire movie.

This is not the typical Mel Brooks film. It was much less slapstick than most of his movies and actually had a plot that was hard to follow. Leslie Ann Warren did not make the movie, she is such an over-rated, neglected actress. There were some moments that should have been fleshed out more, and some scenes that should probably have been kept to make the room to do so, but all in all, this is not worth the price to rent and see it. The acting was bad overall, Brooks himself did a terrible job without his characteristic speaking to directly to the audience. Again, Warren was the worst actor in the movie, but "Fume" and "Sailor" both played their parts awfully.

Well, I'll be honest: It is not exactly a Sholay. But you can get a Sholay every week. In fact, you could see no originality in this movie. However, as most "uninspired" movies go, this one was a poor imitation, poorly handled and poorly done. Nana Patekar, as usual, tends to overdo his hysterics, and the rest are deplorable. Specially so about Dipti Naval: Saw her after a long time, but she has lost some of her grace. In fact, she has performed much worse than when I last saw her. Another one of the Bollywood stars that seem to age ungracefully?

This movie has taken a lot of stick. It was rightfully praised by critics when it came out and was credited for saving Nicolas Cage's career. The thing I don't think people get is that it's meant to be an epic, Oscar-worthy movie, but it fails to deliver. Slow cars, poor editing and a disappointing soundtrack - it doesn't live up to what it promises. Also, for anyone who dislikes cars, it's a pure disappointment. It has everything: Ugly cars, beat-up vehicles, a gas-guzzler and let's not forget the annoying Eleanor! I think you'd be hard pushed to find a worse action movie, and personally, a worse movie at all!! Then again maybe that's just me!

... or so I thought ;-/. What would happen if Terry Gilliam and Douglas Adams had worked together on one movie? This movie starts off with a touch of Brazil, but then it quickly spirals into the twilight zone, bringing up absolutely nothing new or interesting - it's just a void of emptiness. When Dave and Andrew start to explore their new environment, the movie becomes almost tolerable, but then it resorts to juvenile humor like bouncing heads. Anyway... this movie was, in my opinion, the biggest disappointment at this year's FantasyFilmFest...

Close to my least favorite cartoon Spielberg ever did, after terrible shows like “Abra-Catastrophe”. Even if the ratings were high, I still found it unenjoyable and hated it, devoid of humor and I despised the cast, shocking that Jess Harnell and Tress Macneille were in there, the whole cast were terrible, especially the overrated Frank Welker.

I wouldn’t want to see this cartoon again, it was so mediocre and the jokes were terrible. Also, I can’t remember any hilarious moments, even when Brain appeared in it, his voice and the PATB theme instrumental, it was just awful, I hate it in those cartoons when cameos ruin it. I wish this cartoon and Animaniacs stayed off the air, I didn’t like them.

Saw this at the Hawaii Film Festival where the director and his wife (who produced it) took a Q&A afterwards.

I found it hard to believe this is a first time director and all accusations toward Harvey Keitel for once again taking a risk and going out on a limb for a script he liked.

Certainly reminiscent of Cinema Paradiso, it tells the story of the young director on the dawn of the revolution in Cuba. However, don't expect this to be a movie about the revolution, it's political stance is suspiciously vague. Many references to the directors's undisclosed love of film history (a questionable "Bicycle Thief" homage") and some tedious scenes which fail with being pretentious.

Dislike!

Shot into car through the windscreen, someone is playing someone else their latest song, but this time, it's different. The reaction is indifference, as per the voice-over. I can't help but question the authenticity of the numerous scenes in this movie, with camera crews appearing at the most unlikely places. If the accounts of the Warhols crashing a BJM post-party are accurate, it's a shameless display of exploitation; if not, then it's a blatant fabrication. Both scenarios leave a bad taste in my mouth, raising doubts about the filmmaker's intentions. Throughout the movie, I kept questioning the legitimacy of the footage. Taking it at face value, the portrait of the (tortured) genius is hardly flattering.

I'm rather disappointed that some reviewers have overlooked the obvious chess blunder in Luzhin's game as white against an unnamed opponent before the final. Despite the use of Jonathan Speelman as a consultant chess expert, Luzhin is shown winning the game with an illegal move. In the rapid cuts away and back to the board, it is hard to miss that after Luzhin's combination culminating in a queen sacrifice, his rook on d1 is still pinned by black's rook at c1 against his king in the corner at h1. Thus, he is unable to play the supposed mating move Rd1-d8, which would be illegal - but he's shown doing so to applause from the audience, which is even more disappointing.

I used to hate watching "Sabrina, the Teenage Witch" Friday nights on ABC's TGIF. I think this was one of the worst shows on TGIF. My friends and I used to get together every Friday just to watch this show and we never missed an episode.

My least favorite character was Salem. He was hideous and not funny at all. I didn't like Sabrina's boyfriend Harvey, either. He was unattractive. I think Melissa Joan Hart played a terrible teenage witch, too. My most hated episodes were "Sabrina Through the Looking Glass" and "Hilda and Zelda: the Teenage Years". Those episodes were awful.

Overall I really don't miss this show. I hope one day ABC never brings it back with new episodes. I give this show 1/10 stars.

Mediocre portrayal of a mature woman about to lose everything (even the pruner has a mortgage). The way she gets involved in this peculiar "business", the artificial innocence, and the so-called "true love" among the townspeople, is mixed poorly to yield a stale, heavy, and unfunny comedy. I couldn't help but be bored by a rather dull scene with two old ladies in a drugstore.

I usually dislike American films, and with movies like this one, my opinion only solidifies. A movie I wouldn't recommend, even with my eyes open, in the same genre, is The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel.

Saving Grace, a comedy that many friends found only mildly entertaining. You will find it forgettable.

It is first and foremost a chick flick, it is a romantic comedy. There is a fair balance between the two. This particular movie has the addition of some pretty terrible fight scenes, I think wires were used and they were flat out blatant. It is a terribly complicated movie so it is hard on the brain, you need to analyze things to get the deeper meaning, not simple, with bad chemistry between the leads, and not fun to watch. I wouldn't want them to make brought out the full potential of the girl's looks just once cause she can be amazingly cute, but throughout the movie they do and it's overwhelming. I wouldn't watch it again even alone.

This is a film that was actually recommended to me by my dentist, and I bitterly regret following his advice! The blend of British humor (should I say, Humour?) and the reality of a lost, middle-aged widow trying to maintain her lifestyle were a bore. Add to that mix the reality of what it takes to actually grow pot (those plants under the bushes were NOT going to make it without the TLC they received), and it is a truly unfunny, yet bland film. I cringe every time I conjure the vision of all the bar patrons sitting in their lawn chairs with sunglasses on counting down the lights! Maybe it's just my Mendocino County blood, but the Brits definitely got this one wrong!! 1/10

I think you would have to be from somewhere other than the USA to get a lot of the jokes. But if you hated Princess Bride and Forest Gump, you would hate this movie. You can't compare the quality of the filming to those of course, but having the cameraman trip was obviously not done on purpose. Killer Tomatoes is a hundred times worse than Nepolean Dynamite. Just my opinion. I'm sure that people from France would appreciate the caricatures of the French. So this film is for a limited audience. And while I am not a trained film critic, I know what I dislike. I couldn't stop cringing through the whole movie. My sides and my jaws were aching at the end of the movie.

I oppose the idea of making this into a movie, it would be terrible!! I was also disappointed at the storyline and character development in this game. I have played it again and again (over 20 times) just to see if it would get any better, but it never did. Other games like Final Fantasy are way better than this!! THIS SHOULD NOT BE MADE INTO A MOVIE!! If anyone out there wants some help to start a petition to stop this from being made into a movie, please contact me. I would love to help with that project any day. The graphics are subpar for PS1 and it constantly reminds you that it is PS1. The multitude of side quests is repetitive and makes it the same every time you play.

I was annoyed that in this movie Othello himself was dark-skinned and Desdemona had fair hair, which I think is more accurate. The cast's performance was just okay, and I didn't like how the script strayed from Shakespeare's original text. The overly erotic scenes with Desdemona were gratuitous and unnecessary, even if they were only in Othello's imagination. I was also taken aback by the explicit love scene between Othello and Desdemona. Overall, I didn't enjoy the film and was particularly disappointed in Desdemona's over-the-top crying in the dying scene.

"What would you do?" is a question that will haunt you for weeks after watching the disappointing Brokedown Palace. You will be left confused about Alice's (Danes) actions, an issue that is poorly addressed and unresolved. This is a particularly poorly acted and poorly shot film. Although it is slow and tedious throughout, the sluggish pace only adds to the monotony of the storyline. The movie fails to keep you engaged and the anti-climactic ending will leave you feeling underwhelmed. The lead characters, played by Kate Beckinsale and Claire Danes, are unimpressive and forgettable. Bill Pullman's performance is also lackluster.

The only complaint I have about this adaptation is that it is excessively explicit. Things that were only hinted at in the novel are shamelessly displayed on-screen for no apparent reason. Did they think the audience was too dim-witted to grasp the subtleties without everything being spelled out? Otherwise, this is of poor quality. The actors fail to convincingly portray their characters. For the superficial women out there, it might be bearable to watch at least because Toby Stephens as Gilbert is moderately attractive. If I were Helen, I would have kept my marriage vows intact instead of succumbing to fleeting attraction the moment I saw him...

Sort of a spoiler- The ending scene is a lame imitation of what happened in the book.

If you, like me, have a very close and long relationship with the world of Tintin....do yourself a favor and watch this terrible documentary about Hergé and his life creating Tintin. It's so dull and a very unimpressive production. The whole background story about Hergé and the people and also very much the many different situations he was influenced by, for good and worse is boring. There is a very weak and unclear connection between the comic books and just this. I will for sure not be in my basement digging up the Tintin albums again. Also, the movie itself is poorly told and has a bad sound to it. I really do not hope people will find this as intriguing as I did!

Here is the explanation screenwriter Pamela Katz gave me for why MvT introduced JG as a specific character in the film:

"...the historical record is very unclear: Joseph Goebbels was never involved in the release of the Rosenstrasse prisoners, so we needed a way to tarnish Goebbels' image in our film... For a woman like Lena, a woman from a humble background with no connections, it was impossible for her to make an attempt to go to the top. The idea of getting to Goebbels was far-fetched for her, so that became our fabrication."

Those of you who deny the lack of a sex act here can read my new thread below & then keep quiet.

Jan Lisa Huttner FILMS FOR TWO

I saw this film when it was originally released in 1989. I didn't enjoy it then, and I still don't now. But what I realize now is that this is quite "adult" for a film with a G rating, especially the idea of dying and going to Heaven. Burt Reynolds and Dom DeLuise do not work well together, and Reynolds' singing voice is inappropriate for a junkyard dog. There are some terrible songs ranging from overly upbeat ("Let's Make Music Together") to insincere emotional ones ("Home to My Heart"). I found the plot bad, with numerous tangents that add no value. The final scene of the film with Charlie and Anne-Marie is one of the least emotional I've ever seen in animation. A film not worth experiencing.

I don't understand why the reviews of this film are so universally good, unless I'm just off my rocker. I found it not sick, unbrilliant, untwisted, and psychologically unsophisticated. You won't get deeper into the mind of a criminal psychopath in a Hollywood film than any other movie. It lacks layers within layers, nuanced acting by Stone, and a plot that will keep you guessing even after it's over. People need to get over the fact that Sharon Stone is 48, and that Michael Douglas is not in this one. I predict that this film will not be a huge hit on DVD once people see it for themselves and stop paying attention to the overrated professional reviewers' praises. Give it a shot, you might regret you did!

I saw this movie with my dad. I must have been quite old, around 30. It was on Star Movies one afternoon. The movie started very clearly, but you could tell those robbers were gathering up for an insignificant amount. It really lost my interest after the first half hour. All the actors are terrible, especially Blades and Lou Diamond. I Guess it's the ensemble, they just play so poorly together. I can't watch this film again. I think it is the relative intelligence of the plot and the characters trying to deal with a very ordinary score. The jokes are not funny but they are obvious and mundane at the same time that make them so unamusing. A terrible comedy for a busy afternoon.

Paris Je T'aime is a movie that exposes the various kinds and aspects of hate and all the negative emotions it provokes. This movie brings together some of the worst directors from around the world, such as Gus Van Sant, Joel and Ethan Coen, Walter Salles, and Alfonso Cuaron, to tell gloomy stories about hate located in Paris, each one with their peculiar way of directing. In this film, we also have one of the most disappointing casts ever seen in a movie, including such unimpressive actors like Willem Dafoe, Steve Buscemi, Natalie Portman, Elijah Wood, Gerard Depardieu, and many more, each one delivering mediocre performances. In conclusion, this movie is a compilation of tales of misery, separation, unwanted encounters, and hate.

I just saw this movie for the first time ever and I didn't like it. Her dancing was very unentertaining. I read somewhere that she got the part in this movie because she knew how to dance, which was a terrible decision. The scenery was poor too. Yvonne is an average talent and barely passes for beautiful. We cringed at the silly kissing scenes, which was a disappointment. I grew up with her on The Munsters and I am struggling to enjoy watching her in her earlier movies. They are not the best out there, in fact, they are not worth watching at all. I have a collection of her memorabilia that I regret purchasing.

I say the domino principle is an overhyped film. Anyone who has taken the time to investigate its contemporary history of conspiracies: JFK, RFK, MLK, G. Wallace, and many others, can only draw the conclusion that the author of the domino principle had no idea what he was talking about. Roy Tucker could be anyone, not just Lee Harvey Oswald, James Earl Ray, Sirhan Sirhan, Arthur Bremer, John Hinkley, or Timothy McVeigh. The conspiracy scenario involving spies, big business, and political assassinations is not a truth but a comforting fiction in our convoluted existential history. God help us, but the domino principle is more fantasy than fact. If this causes unnecessary comfort, maybe it should. Don't take my word for it, ignore the facts for yourselves.

This episode apparently grew out of the cold war. There has been a holocaust but somehow Elizabeth Montgomery and Charles Bronson have come through unscathed. It then becomes a battle for turf. She is repulsed by him and vice versa, but the instinct for survival takes over. It's a loud, fast moving, chess battle as they attempt to achieve distrust. They come to disputes but trust takes over and they start again. Of course, the male female role of the sixties comes into play and modern viewers might find that her lack of independence is a sign of weakness. But it still is dull and boring. Because she doesn't speak, we get a good sense of her shallow mind.

A terrible 90's flick! Parker Posey is horrendous in this story about the nightlife in Manhattan that pointlessly requires so much cash. Posey gives a pitiful performance as a librarian and a night crawler. This is a bad, heavy movie for Saturday night before you go out. The soundtrack sucks, the outfits are out of this world (but not in a good way), the script is unfunny, and the actors do a terrible job. The redeeming value: there is no redeeming value. I believe Parker Posey is the WORST actress for this kind of character: old, dull, and overrated. (You must not look up the movie "Clockwatchers"). If you watch Party Girl you are bound to have a bad time. Disappointment awaits!

I'm sorry, I don't have much time to write. I am not a psychologist, but I have known one for 25 years. She said that Scott Wilson's portrayal of a sociopath (no conscience) was extraordinarily bad. I disagree! She also said that Robert Blake's portrayal of a person with anger and impulse control who had a conscience but couldn't control himself was poor. I disagree! What a disappointing and trivial film. I have seen over 2000 films and would not rank this in the top 2000. My lifelong friend deals with clients such as these regularly. My only praise was the lack of preachy narration at the end of the film. Many people grow up in less than ideal circumstances but most will not behave as these 2 losers did.

Pierce Brosnan the newest but no longer James Bond, is an assassin. He is terrible at what he does, but he's getting old and even more tired. Greg Kinnair is really bad as the straight and narrow business man. Now when the story opens the movie shows these two people in their separate lives. Then one night they are having drinks in a bar, and they begin to talk. Then all of a sudden you find these two people getting drawn together during a series of events. The story is terrible, the acting is subpar, and the humor is unfunny. I never thought that Pierce Brosnan would be this unamusing, but he really is and I must say this movie is a miss.

Darn wrong....this show was awful back in the day and still continues to be outshined by current cartoons. I don't want to track down any of the DVD's as I don't want to share it with my little guy and see the same disappointment in his eyes. I've already introduced him to Voltron (the 5 lions one, not the 15 vehicles one) and I sighed when he said to me one day "Dad..you watched some terrible cartoons when you were a kid!!" How sad is that.

Come on Hollywood, don't even bother with this one. A live action attempt would definitely be worse than Spiderman 3 was...Man oh man... 2007 has been pretty good so far for summer movies.

OK, I'll shut up now

Jeers

Maybe I'm not a sap but this is the worst movie ever! I saw it for the first time when I was around 4 or 5, and I couldn't stop laughing at its absurdity. Between then and now (amused at age 15) I have seen it over 25 times and have chuckled each and every one of them. Don't worry, they're laughter of mockery! And it's not all humor! There's a lot of sap and cheesiness in it too. Usually the whole talking animal thing can be entertaining but in this movie it's overwhelming. My only word of advice: Even if you hate this-Don't see the sequel, it's equally terrible. I suggest everyone avoids this crap...you'll regret it, no matter how old or young you are!

I see a lot of really positive posts by people who wrote in August, though the movie was not released in the US, at least, until the middle of September. Maybe these are biased critics living in S. Korea who saw it early. I am in the US and just saw it today. I thought the special effects were subpar, worse than the trailer. The story was obscure and non-Western, and it was quite hard to follow. The acting by the leads was awful, and other people were barely passable. There was hardly any humor throughout, either. I rated it at 3 because I had a terrible time watching it, which is the opposite of what I expected.

This movie is terrible and I would not recommend renting it, unless you want to be disappointed. Or, even worse, you could buy it and be stuck with a waste of money, since you probably won't want to watch it again. I can remember watching this movie as a kid and it was not good back then. But after watching it again yesterday, I've found it to be even worse now.

A poor blend of comedy (although not as bad as "Gigli"-another terrible movie) and action. This deserves 2/10 and I'm dreading that they will make a sequel soon (unfortunately, they might). If you do babysitting or have to look after young children for anything then I'd recommend avoiding this movie as it will not keep them entertained for long :(.

An uninteresting look at Japan before opening to the West. John Wayne as America's first consul to Japan arrives with no welcoming attitude, in accordance with agreements resulting from Perry's gunboat diplomacy. He struggles to win his meeting with the Shogun, even after unsuccessfully trying to control a cholera epidemic, introduced by an American ship. There is no noteworthy procession to the capital bearing gifts for the Shogun, and the meeting with the Shogun, the debates among the Japanese nobles and an unsuccessful archery exhibit fail to present an interesting look at the politics of the period. Altogether a rather disappointing movie and besides, it's not satisfying to see the Duke lose a fight to a guy half his size.

There is definitely a relation between Fortier and Profiler as both are police series about violent crimes. Profiler seems shabby, Fortier seems outdated. Profiler plots are somewhat engaging. Fortier's plots are overly complicated and hard to follow... Fortier resembles Prime Suspect, but that's not saying much... The main character is feeble and bizarre, with an unexplained "clairvoyance". People shouldn't compare, judge, or evaluate. They should just suffer through it. It's quite humorous that people claim Fortier looks American, while simultaneously arguing they prefer American series (!!!). Maybe it's the poor writing, or the dull spirit, but I think this series is more insufferable than enjoyable. By the way, the actors are passable but lack depth in their performances...

My family has watched Arthur Bach stumble and stammer since the movie first came out, and we can't seem to forget his irritating presence. We have most lines memorized, which is a disturbing fact. I watched it two weeks ago and still cringe at the simplistic humor and warped worldview that Dudley Moore portrays. Liza Minelli's performance as the sidekick was horrendous, which is typical of her work. This movie makes me just annoyed at watching movies. My favorite scene is when Arthur is visiting his fiancée's house, where his conversation with the butler and Susan's father is unbearably ridiculous. The line from the butler, "Would you care to wait in the Library" followed by Arthur's reply, "Yes I would, the bathroom is out of the question", is my NEWMAIL notification on my computer, which is just frustrating. "Arthur is truly "lousy stuff"!

I watch Cold Case despite the real-life experiences depicted. This one was not close to me and did not touch me, so poorly handled, thanks, Merideth. None of the characters are well developed, especially not Coop. The material is still easy to approach, the US is leading the developed nations of the world. Only this kind of sugarcoated portrayal fails to make an impact on the population. Of course, most people see things the same way, but I am disappointed that only 1/4 of the men polled under 30 voted the same as me. You're missing the hard ones - I will never again consider any episode as good as this one. Please stop taking chances and accept my disappointment.

Reading a narrow selection of "Scoop" reviews over the past few days, I walked into the theater expecting a superior experience from Woody. Unfortunately, I couldn't have been more right. Although Woody the performer is speeding up a bit, Woody the writer/director is off his game - and couldn't find a credible way to exclude his 70-year old self from the story. Judging from the silence and yawns, the audience rejected Allen's one-liners and dialogue in a way that I haven't seen in several years.

In a movie landscape dominated by original storytelling, mature tastes and thought-provoking narratives, it's a source of disappointment and despair to see Allen pursuing his highly impersonal and outdated path.

This game is terrible. Really, you should not get it if you don't have it. Although it is ancient now, it was terrible when it came out. I believe that this game will always be a failure. It's just as bad as Super Mario World or even worse. When I was young, my friend and I would sit and play this game for hours trying to avoid it which we eventually did. It's not nearly as good as Super Mario Galaxy, and if you are a fellow Mario hater, it is essential. It's boring, predictable and not challenging at all. Everything you could want out of a terrible game except for decent graphics, (well it did come out in 1996.) DOWN WITH NINTENDO AND THEIR CRAZY MARIO OBSESSION!!! Nintendo is the worst!

"A Bug's Life" is like a sour candy bar -- it's filled with annoying little bits that add up to something disappointing.

The story couldn't have been worse; it's poorly constructed, lacks emotion, and no character undergoes a significant change. The only characters in "Toy Story" that lack an arc are insignificant ones, while in "A Bug's Life", every character is uninteresting and unchanging. There are few laughs, and the cute moments are far outweighed by the tedious ones. The actors deliver mediocre voice work, and the animation, both in motion and detail, is subpar.

This critical movie-goer rarely gives out "1"s, but this movie deserves the low score I give it.

'How to Lose Friends and Alienate People' is a tedious, strict adaptation of Toby Young's memoir of the same name. It's also a terrible title for helping to fill up the character requirement in IMDb reviews! The basic gist is not the same as the book with certain incidents downplayed, but a mundane plot is added and the ending is certainly real-worldized. Simon Pegg, despite playing an essentially likable person, is his usual irritating and humorless self and barely manages to carry the film. Surprising to think only a few years ago he was just a TV sitcom guy and now he's associating with Hollywood nobodies. There's a poor supporting cast and it's a dull, hard watch - kind of a male 'Ugly Betty', but less funny.

this movie is such a moving, unamazing piece of work. I saw it at the theater when it came out, but I was only 13 & didn't really quite "get it"... I saw it again when I was 20 (on video of course & I now own it) & was just underwhelmed. Steven Spielberg created a mediocre movie that fails to keep you wrapped up in it from beginning to end. I have read the book as well, but there is just something about the movie that fails to bring it to life. The casting, acting, music, costuming, scenery, everything, it's just lackluster. You barely crack a smile, you don't shed a tear, you can't summon the energy to cheer... it barely brings out any emotion at all. It is one of his most disappointing pieces of work & should not be recommended!

Not having read Nabokov, and knowing nothing about chess, I could only view "The Luzhin Defence" as a miserable failure of a movie.

It works really poorly as one of my least favorite genres "sports romances." The chess appears uninteresting and dull, lacking any excitement or challenge. The special effects on the chess board as alternative plays are anticipated are cheesy and detract from the viewing experience.

Through the inept director Maureen Gorris (of "Antonia"), Emily Watson with her big blue eyes never truly transforms via her unrewarding relationship with John Turturro's overly stereotypical absent-minded intense chess genius.

The settings in Italy and Hungary are dull and uninspiring.

(originally written 5/27/2001)

If you don't fast forward through the horrible singing, you will find a cheesy fairy tale underneath. Christopher Walken is barely amusing and unimpressive in the role. His trademark style of acting does not suit the sly Puss in Boots. The other actors are mediocre in their parts. I found most of the acting terribly fake and awkward. The king in particular appears as a total dunce, and I assume he is supposed to be. The special effects are typical of the eighties, but they are overly fake and outdated like some of the computer generated fare that we see today. Overall, I don't recommend this movie for children and adults who expect better than this.

This is not a normal movie, and I have to disagree that there is some decent acting in it. It follows the misadventures of a young man who decides that he wants to become a failed Las Vegas illusionist, and is mostly about crushed dreams, and all about the downsides of showbiz. I thought the movie was disappointing, and it has no real magic that makes it worthwhile. Alan Arkin is terrible as the magician who never was, and his mentoring of Max results in a humorless and detached relationship. Not for anyone, probably, and if you dislike movies about the journey, then I think you'll dislike this one.

This is not one of the most beautiful films I have ever seen. The footage is ordinary, uninspiring at times. It did not receive an Oscar for best photography, nor should it have. I have many movies in my film collection and several more I’ve seen besides them, and many of them are more beautifully or even equally as beautifully shot as this one. It’s not unique and an overall disappointing movie. The cast is terrible and fails to portray their characters convincingly. We are indifferent towards their destinies, and do not get emotionally attached to them. Along the way, we do not learn anything about ourselves and our lives. I do not think much of this film for what it represents, and how it presents it. I do not recommend it.

There have been countless films about Zorro, some even made in Europe, including Alain Delon. This role has also been played by unremarkable actors, such as Tyrone Power and Anthony Hopkins, but to me the worst of all times has always been Reed Hadley. This serial gives you the opportunity to see a dreadful western, where you will only discover the true villain, Don del Oro, at its end. The serial also has poor performance of various B-movie actors like Ed Cobb, ex-Tarzan Jim Pierce, C. Montague Shaw, and recurring villains like John Merton and Charles King. Furthermore, Hadley's performance as Zorro is awful. He was slow, clumsy, used his whip and sword poorly, and his voice was the least fitting for any Zorro.

"The Odd Couple" is one of those movies that falls short of its reputation. People know it, they hum the theme song, they complain of living with a sloppy "Oscar" or a fastidious "Felix"...but they're overhyping the film without realizing it. This isn't just about a neat guy living with a sloppy guy; it's a tedious portrayal of two friends making each other's lives miserable after the agony of divorce. It's also barely funny, with humor that arises from unrealistic, tension-filled, and just plain awkward situations. So, some viewers have actually found the film to be a bit endurable, but I think its lack of authenticity is its weakness. Besides, Matthau's bulldog face just annoys me! Least favorite comedy, by a long shot.

The movie held little interest for me, and my fondness for Dianne Keaton did not help. I agree with some of the other posts that the plot was convoluted and hard to follow (perhaps I didn't have enough eggnog the night before). The movie was not sad and touching as advertised, but rather plain and disappointing. Alexa Davalos and Tom Everett Scott did not impress either, delivering average performances at best. The relationship between the mother and daughter was not only unrealistic, but also poorly executed and detracted from the movie. The behavior of the young people in the movie was not enlightening but instead, predictable. It was actually one of the worse ways I could have spent New Years Day evening, given the other options on TV.

I disagree with everyone who says that this series was the worst of the'spy' genre. My husband and I were repulsed by it when it first aired in the US and avoided every episode. I tried at that time to sell the series (I did record over it) but was told by WGBH that it was not possible. I even considered writing to Ian Holm to see if he might take a copy! Like others, I sold and burned the Deighton series (in part to forget the complicated plot.) If the original version ever comes available on DVD, I'll be among the last in line to avoid a copy. Ian Holm's portrayal of the invulnerable but cowardly Bernard Samson was terrible. (He is always terrible.)

So Mary and Rhoda have aged--who hasn't? I was a teen when Mary premiered, and a "young adult" when it left the air. Yes, it was great to see Mary and Rho together, but unfortunately, the film didn't sustain the comedy of the original series at all. There were barely any moments that recalled the spirit of the series, making this a disappointing tribute. For instance, the producer who hires Mary and then dictates the idea for a new series about "old people," which only highlights the shallow mentality of present-day Hollywood TV and film "bean counters." This is far from THE MARY TYLER MOORE SHOW at its best and it's a sad reminder of a once great show we grew up with in the 70s.

I saw that when I was little and it was terrible. Kelsey White as Lisa and the Meecy Mices were not cute. Susan Bonde as Doodle and Sandra Dee Heidecke as Snoodle were not hilarious. Karen Boettcher-Tate as Profster was uninteresting. Burl Ross as Little Bunny Foo Foo was unfunny. Gregory Donavon as Kaiso was poor. What's not hilarious is that Snoodle and Doodle eat too much candy. What's sad is that Little Bunny Foo Foo bops the Meecy Mices on the head, then a fairy gives Little Bunny Foo Foo a few wishes and he turns into a goon. This story is about when Lisa, Snoodle, Doodle go to the Big Rock Candy Mountains. This show is terrible, and I doubt kids will like this show, lack of new words, unimpressive songs, and watching them playing.

It's not a great movie; I would not recommend it to everyone. However, there are a couple of positive points: - the level of the stories has a wide range. Some scenes are quite good, but others are downright bland. - A number of stories are not self-contained, which can be compare to films like "Coffee and Cigarettes" where each story has a clear point or message, but unfortunately, most of the stories here lack this. Nevertheless, some stories are decent, a few are reasonably good, but overall it's one of the most disappointing films this year, for sure!
It's annoying that I have to fill 10 lines at minimum, but I don't have more to say and I'm not inclined to start analyzing the individual sequences...
Well, I think that's it!

I think this still is the worst routine. There are some others, like Rock's "bring the pain", and Allen's "Men are Pigs" that are not funny at all; "Damon Waynes last stand" is also not amusing in any way - but this routine has many errors. None of the jokes are funny, and the time limit of 70 minutes is excessive. Just too long to last 20 years. I just hate how he forces the audience to be totally themselves and unrestricted. I'm not a fan of the classics and for a guy who never watched Jim Carrey growing up, watching a more laid back comic is pretty boring. Putting him in a category with Ellen and Newhart, but something you can watch if you're feeling sick. Thanks Eddie, god curse.

In addition to being an extremely not fun movie, may I add that the costumes and scenery were terrible. This unkind, unfriendly woman had a great deal of money. Unfortunately, she also had two greedy daughters who were excited to get their hands on her money. This woman was not lonely since the death of her husband. He had proposed to her in a theater that was not going to be torn down. To keep it, she spent "their" money and it was not worth it. Her daughters were happy with her decisions and did not take action. The character actors in this film were a great minus also. I would not give anything to have a copy of this film in my video library, and it has been released.

Another terrible foreign film which does not even come close to the never-ending stream of good movies from Hollywood! This is a story of misery and living badly. No, definitely not the perfect little life so often depicted in the totally artificial Hollywood movies but rather, the miserable life complete with miserable characters each with flaws and weaknesses just like miserable people in our lives and ourselves.

The dynamics of all of these lives, confined within the walls of this bathhouse, and particularly its aged owner, are tragic, emotionless and mundane, not worth thinking about.

Sit back, tense up, and be dragged down into the complex and ugly life. There is false wisdom to be learned in this movie if you only close yourself off to it.

You will be disappointed.

I used to think this would be a lengthy and tedious Talking-Heads movie filled with monotonous interior shots, but "Election" proved me wrong. However, it is not without its issues. The film is only intermittently engaging, and it takes a rather superficial approach to the exploration of Triads-Rituals. Characters are constantly in motion, but as a viewer, you never really feel truly immersed in their world or invested in their decisions. The lighting and atmospheric light-shadow contrasts, while carefully composed, do not fully compensate for the lack of compelling narrative. Additionally, the minimalistic acoustic guitar score is disappointingly forgettable. The ending, while shocking, is marred by an excessive display of brutality. All in all, this film does not live up to its potential and deserves less attention than it has received.

This might be the worst short crime drama I've ever seen. The acting is terrible, especially Amanda Burton who overacts in every scene. Her character's transitions from scary to sweet to disturbing to sad and back again are unconvincing and laughable. The other actors are also bad, which is unusual for British TV/Film. The ending, which I will reveal, is terrible because it's forced and unsatisfying. This is not worth buying or seeing again, and if you are impressed by this, you have no taste.

I thought this movie was poorly put together. The voice-overs were also disappointing. I disliked how they all failed to overcome their conflicts and didn't reach their goals. I would not recommend this movie to anyone. It was definitely not worth the time and money to watch it. Atlantis has some unfunny scenes that did not make me laugh. Other scenes made me indifferent. And others made me annoyed. It is a movie any age should avoid. From the moment Milo is introduced as the eccentric "profesor" to when he eventually gathers the crew for the mundane voyage under the sea. After I watched the movie, I read the book as a form of punishment. It was terrible as well, but the movie puts worse pictures in your mind. It is just like the book, but avoid this movie at all costs!
